story:
Solvang Faeriefest
Solvang Festival Theater

420 2nd. Street, Solvang, CA


October 13, 2012

Solvang Faeriefest is an arts and music festival that celebrates life in the magical spirit of fae! This is an all-ages event that promotes creativity, imagination, unity, and diversity held in Solvang, CA, the Danish Capital of America!

Faeriefest aims at giving peformance opportunities to local artists, and features local artisans and visual artists. It promotes collaboration among creators while at the same time inviting the public to have a great time and experience unique performances and artwork based on fairy tales, folklore, spirituality, magic, anachronism, and fantasy.

 

We first Solvang Faeriefest for the first time at the Solvang Festival Theater,  October 15, 2011, and we had over 400 people show up! You can check out past festival photos here: http://faeriefest.livejournal.com/

The rough budget breakdown is as follows:

$600.00 - Venue

$1000.00 - Sound and lightning

$500.00 - Insurance and administrative fees 

$1,500 - Advertising, PR and marketing

$1,000 - Costuming, Sets, installations, crewing

$400 - Guest artist traveling expenses

Please help us spread the word! You can find our facebook group and event pages here!

http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Solvang-Faeriefest/112216322217576

http://www.facebook.com/#!/events/374493889258384/

We've had a great response from folks attending last year, and we are comming back as promised with a better, bigger Faeriefest!

About the rewards

Everybody who helps us bring Faeriefest to life with $5.00 or more will be rewarded with stickers and good Karma! If you donate $10.00 or more, you will also receive your tickets in advance. For those of you that donate $25.00 or more, you will get exclusive apparel and gifts made by our very talented staff, ranging from t-shirts to leather masks, magical grimmoires, cuddly mushrooms, giant bubble sets, and even your very own custom-made fantasy character costume by our artistic director, who has done costuming for SBCC Theater Group, Summer Solstice Parade, Ballet Santa Barbara, Danish Days, and many, many clients that have proudly worn her designs all around the world!

 

Here's for previews of the rewards:

Maybe you're not a nice faerie... that's ok, we have a logo for bad faeries too!

Need some magic in your life? how about our cuddly Mushrooms!

There's also many one-of-a-kind masks waiting for you!

And don't forget to check out our hand-crafter grimmoires

 

 

Getting involved

Are you in a band? Would you like to vend at our event? Are you a performer? Do you have a troupe? Would you like to just come out and volunteer and have a good time? Would you like free tickets? Please join us! We welcome anybody that wants to be a part of Faeriefest! Please email us at tarmias_dancebit (at) hotmail (dot) com  or call 805-794-8958 for more information! We'd love to hear from you!

story:
Our Storyline

In a time of enormous crisis in Greece two award winning photographers and cinematographers- Stratis Vogiatzis and Thekla Malamou – with a supportive team of artists and researchers will go on a year and a half long journey, a passage, a caravan project all around Greece. Their aim is to shed light on an inspiring Greece that continues to dream and create.  They will travel and document the austere culture in the most barren and remote parts of Greece, bring forth testimonials of people's personal experiences, and create a collection of documentary films, photographs, texts and narratives that will focus on the existence of a different way of life in Greece, one contrary to the one that the mass media chooses to constantly portray.  In all these ways, we declare that Another World Is Here.

 

Another Wold Is Here is going to incorporate the following projects:
 
 

I. Α series of documentary films based on Â“"Extraordinary People”

 These films will reveal both the environment and unique way of life of each “extraordinary person” through their own eyes. The inner link that will connect these stories/documentaries will be the resilience of the human spirit, a passion for life, and the ability of each human being to form his or her own destiny. The first documentary that we already completed is about a blind fisherman with one hand in the village of Lagada on the island of Chios which won the won the Audience Award on the 14th International film festival in Thessaloniki 

II. A mosaic of stories

Every person is a collection of stories and our stories are what make up our own, unique personality, from a grandmother telling a fairytale, to someone’s deepest need to tell his story in order to be understood. By asking the question “Tell me the story you like to tell the most”, our aim is to record accounts of people from all over Greece, creating a mosaic of stories which, in their own way, will add color to the Greek soul. Our target is to form a collection of these stories, enriched with photography and texts, so that through exhibitions and presentations we can spread the power and the meaning of the personal story.
 

III. Documenting Remote Areas (Agoni Grami)

The remotest areas in Greece may be isolated, but they definitely should not be forgotten since they are throbbing with stories and symbols that reveal a rough and difficult way of life. Yet at the same time, life in these areas is full of simplicity, without pretense, and in harmony with the rhythm of nature. We believe that in these forgotten corners of Greece, there lies an invaluable civilization of authenticity and a true wisdom, which has a lot to reveal about the historical identity of Greece. Οur aim is to produce a photography album based on the way of life we reveal, the houses and the landscape of Agoni Grammi, and also incorporate audiovisual material highlighting short stories of people living in these remote areas.


Our motivation, Our mission

Greece is  portrayed in the foreign media as a country of corruption, a bankrupt country, not only economic but also political and ethical terms, a ‘lost case’ as many foreign media repsensatives call it. We would like to change this portrayal.  It is of vital importance for us to light up a side of Greece which is hidden and usually ignored by the media, to give a new lease on life to a Greece which continues to give us inspiration. Due to the disruption and isolation of the economic crisis, now, more than ever, we feel the imperative need for a fresh assessment of our country and way in which we live. It is time for a new vehicle toward education of ourcultural space - a caravan to show the Another World is here.

 Our aim is to convey real-life stories and experiences with the utmostauthenticity so as to pass on forgotten values and re-examine the principles,which bring us closer to a more meaningful way of life. Conveying stories is the thread which is woven deep in our lives, our consciousness, our humanity. It has the power το bring understanding amongst the the most diverse peoples of the world. Since storytelling is a dialogue, shared stories create more understanding and bring people closer together as a community.

Along our travels, we will inform local people of our work through slideshows and discussions in the communities and village squares, thus creating an alternative method and location for education. In cooperation with cultural institutes and universities – like Panteio University and Museum of Photography in Greece - we will organize exhibitions, and slide shows in Greece and abroad, to inspire people through our work.  We will teach the value of personal story and concurrently create a multicultural arena full of information propelling people toward collaboration and participation with the work.

  

Where does the money go


We estimate that we need $32,000 total for production and post-production costs. These include, - Editing - Graphics  - The output and delivery of an industry standard high quality formated documentary films - Sound design and colour grade.  We expect to cover the majority of that expense through grants from private citizens and institutes in Greece. However, in order to ensure that we can deliver the complete project consisting of documentaries, photographs, and narratives, we are hoping to raise $14,000 through this Indiegogo campaign.

 To make the caravan project a reality, we need additional technical equipment, running costs and production costs. We will produce at least 6 documentaries regarding "extraordinary people" (around 30min length), 5 short documentaries (around 5min length) and the personal narratives as a multimedia  project. Over the span of a year and a half we will also complete the photography book of our journey.

We will then be able to deliver the documentary films to several broadcasters, have it premier in international film festivals and to allow it reach broad audiences worldwide, including straight to you!

All our incentives for your donations are listed to the right, and we thank you in advance for your support!

 

What we have done so far

The Caravan Project actually began five months ago. Since then we have filmed and produced the “Blind Fisherman”, the first documentary of the series “Extraordinary People”. This documentary has won the Audience Award on the 14th International film festival in Thessaloniki 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jgTF9_E23uE

We also completed the web documentary “Paporias: the last boat carpenter”. We have begun  to record narrations of personal stories, as well as collect audiovisual material about the Remote Areas of Greece (agoni grammi). Moreover, we have built our web page as a hub of multiculturalism, a platform for information and participation. You can see everything completed so far at:

www.anotherworldishere.com.

 

previous links

 

We completed the project  ‘People of the Sea’ after 5 years which is about the life of the fisherman in the Meditteranean Sea, in seven different countries. A unique project   about the world of fisherman in Mediterranean Sea

http://www.vimeo.com/21270979

 

We published the award winning book ‘Inner World’ about houses’ interiors on the island of Chios in Greece. The project was exhibited at a photobiennale in Greece, in Italy, at the Greek embassy in Washington, at the Chelsea Hotel in NY and many other countries.

 

http://www.vimeo.com/22054904

 

Other ways you can help

 

These times are financially tough for all of us: if money is not flowing freely for you, please give by passing on the word about our project to anyone you know who would be interested. Follow our updates and comment on our progress. We need your enthusiasm.  Help us get the word out by reposting this on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or other social media outlets. Get this page and our videos out there. And of course - Donate if you can! Even if it's a small amount, it brings us closer to our goal.

story:
About us:

We believe that being a part of change is being a part of the most important work in the world.

At Art Works for Change, we create contemporary art exhibitions and innovative projects that address social justice and environmental issues across the globe. We harness the power of art to promote awareness, provoke dialogue, and inspire action.

What we need:

Recently, we created a new adaptation of Oware, an ancient game from Africa. Our version of Oware, called AWARE/OWARE combines storytelling, art, and gameplay to promote positive health practices and human rights in Africa. In 2011, Art Works For Change debuted the game in Cape Town, South Africa, and it’s traveled throughout that country over the past year. We now have an opportunity to bring AWARE/OWARE to Senegal, in partnership with Sister Fa, the country's inspirational "Queen of Hip Hop" and a tireless human rights activist.

In Senegal, as in many countries, advances in children's health are impeded by a lack of awareness, limited resources, gender bias, and discrimination. Simply put: girls and boys don’t learn about and adopt positive health practices, and understand why they matter.

Through gaming, art and wordplay, AWARE/OWARE starts conversations that increase awareness of critical health issues among young people, inspiring the next generation of Senegalese to take action on malaria, HIV/AIDs, and reproductive health.

We're hoping to raise funds to join Sister Fa on tour in December. However, plane tickets are expensive and we’re asking for your help to get us there.

Your financial support will allow us to bring a 4-person team of organizers, artists and bloggers to travel with Sister Fa for one week this December. During the tour, we’ll directly engage more than 1,500 children at schools in five Senegalese cities, and leave behind the tools and techniques to keep the game and the conversation going after we're gone.

Please play a part in our AWARE/OWARE Senegal campaign and make a donation today.

What people have said about our South African campaign:

"The idea of artworks being used as a game is an innovative one as I believe that art should be taken into community places and not be confined solely to galleries and museums. The project empowered a large number of communities in South Africa…"
- Carol Brown, Director, CURATE.A.SPACE


"I am amazed at the way the AWARE/OWARE game is being innovatively used to empower women."
- Dr. Rudo Sithole, Executive Director, AFRICOM, International Council of African Museums


"The AWARE/OAWRE workshop was beneficial to all the artists involved including technical progress, added confidence, a forum for debate, an opportunity to share ideas with artists from across Cape Town and beyond, and a chance for personal growth."
- Greatmore Studios, Cape Town, South Africa


"Thanks to Art Works for Change, the AWARE/OWARE game funded women artists and crafters from a disadvantaged rural area of South Africa—they could earn through their skills, while telling the true stories of their lives."
 - Florence Danais, The Keiskamma Trust


"Organizations such as Art Works for Change who use creative and innovative strategies to raise awareness and educate communities, have demonstrated that art can act as a powerful tool and catalyst for social change within communities by cutting across literacy barriers, race, creed or religion - this is something very much needed in South Africa."
- Nthabiseng Mlumbi, President, Women in Business Empowerment Network


"We would like to thank Art Works for Change whose project has benefit us by providing us, women affected/infected by HIV and AIDS, much needed time together discussing this issue."
- Woza Moya, Hillcrest AIDS Centre Trust

story:
In November 2012 Krista Dalby and Susanne Larner will be travelling to Ghana, Africa, as volunteers. They’ll be working in small rural villages in the Volta Region where there is limited schooling, medicine, housing and other basic needs.  Over the course of 2 weeks they will be teaching puppetry to up to 200 children; working together to tell traditional Ghanaian stories through shadow puppetry, culminating in a community performance.

From Krista Dalby, Puppeteer in Chief: As many of you know, this type of project is not new to me.  I'm a volunteer with ArtsCan Circle (www.artscancircle.ca), undertaking similar projects in remote First Nations communities, as well as teaching puppetry in local schools through the Ontario Arts Council's Artist in Education program.  I feel compelled to take my work to Ghana as the children there have limited opportunities to explore the arts, and virtually no access to art supplies. Imagine if your child had no paper, no scissors, no glue, no crayons, no string, no markers... you get the idea. It would be pretty difficult to make anything. It is my goal to open up a new type of artwork and performance to these children using basic materials, to empower them by celebrating their stories, and to leave behind some art supplies in the community so they can continue to exercise their creativity. 

To realize this vision we are collaborating with DIVOG, a Ghanaian nonprofit organization that builds global partnerships to empower underdeveloped rural communities throughout Ghana (www.divog.org). By making a pledge on our behalf, you are supporting the development of these children and contributing to a greater world of understanding and awareness. There is a $749 program cost for each of us to participate in DIVOG's volunteer program. Over 85% of this fee goes directly to the programs; the other 15% is administration. Other expenses include flights, vaccinations, travel visas and art supplies.  Lots and lots of art supplies.

Your support, no matter what the amount, is deeply appreciated.  Any funds raised above and beyond our goal will be donated directly to the community.

Thank you in advance for supporting our dream to bring joy and creativity to the children of rural Ghana. Please contact me if you have any questions or comments about this program.

Krista Dalby - krista@smallpondarts.ca

story:
Dear friends and colleagues of Red Trillium Press:

Defining books arts as an artistic medium we share a passion for storytelling, a love of materials and embrace traditional methods and new technologies.  Books are vehicles for communication, crossing cultural and political divides as well as centuries of knowledge.

I am returning to Vietnam March 13, 2014 for twelve days to teach a series of book arts workshops at the Hanoi Fine Arts University.

In 2008, with the support of the Boston Printmakers and the United States Cultural Envoy Program, I ran the first series of book arts workshops ever taught in Hanoi.

1.    Four-day workshop at the Contemporary Fine Arts Center, Hanoi, attended by 13 Vietnamese printers, painters, and graphic designers.

2.    Two-day workshop at the Kim Don Publishing House.

3.    Other book activities happened spontaneously during my travels around Hanoi and the countryside. It was easy to carry a notebook of paper sharing simple fold structures with villagers I met outside of Hanoi.

4.    The final weeklong workshop, at the Contemporary Fine Arts Center, we fabricated the accordion book Ha Noi Is My Love, a 12-artist collaboration of woodcut, lithography, and digital images printed on Vietnamese Dzo paper, celebrating the 1000-year anniversary of Ha Noi in 2010.

5.    Photographs documenting the trip are on the Red Trillium Press Flickr page.

2014 Workshops:

Building on the 2008 workshops in Hanoi I am teaching artist's book workshops at two art universities in Hanoi. If the past is an indicator I will be offering additional workshops to groups outside the university. These workshops are the first experience with book arts these students will have.

A year in the making, this March trip to Hanoi would not be possible without the support of the Indochina Arts Project paying my plane fare. One university is coving the cost of the hotel for 6 days. 

I am covering the cost of the additional days for the hotel, all meals and transportation in Hanoi. As with all my workshops in Hanoi or Cuba I am donating my time and skills towards teaching book arts.

Help share this passion for book arts that all of us have. Will you donate on- line  $1 or more today, so Red Trillium Press can continue developing a dialog for the future in book arts with these amazing Vietnamese artists and students? 

What we need:  

Red Trillium Press is asking for your support to raise a $1000 for supplies, materials, and books on book arts.

What you will receive:  

A traditional Vietnamese print and tax deduction, how cool is that? A tax-break for helping support the teaching of book arts to Vietnamese students and artists. (Commies: for all of us who grew up in the sixties.)  

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help make some noise about our campaign!
  • Spread the word to your book arts and print-minded friends, loved ones, and acquaintances.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this on Facebook, Twitter, etc!
  • If you are a journalist or blogger- link this project on your blog!
  • If you are a college student, you can talk to your special collections librarian about the Red Trillium Press collaborations and teaching in Cuba and Hanoi ask them to purchase book from Red Trillium Press.
  • If you are a college professor in book arts or printmaking consider inviting Red Trillium Press for an exhibition of the press’ books, Cuban and Vietnamese artists book and prints.
  • Like the Red Trillium Press Facebook page-it is the best way to stay informed!

Thanks!

Please e-mail info@redtrilliumpress.com or call (413-695-7990) with any questions about donating to Red Trillium Press or about donating book arts materials (instructional books & catalogs- digital and hard copy, basic binding tools and printmaking supplies are welcome too) needed for this visit to Hanoi.

Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, are you fit to be a teacher.         Confucius

With my deepest gratitude and warmest regards,

Steven Daiber

story:
Chelsea College of Art and Design offers a unique opportunity for you to help fund the MA
2011 Graduate Show Catalogue. Unfortunately the University is unable to financially support our catalogue so any help you can offer would be invaluable.

The Graduate Show Catalogue is a comprehensive publication showcasing up-and-coming, cutting edge work from the current MA students within the disciplines of Fine Art, Curating, Textiles, Art Theory, Graphic Design Communication and Interior and Spatial Design.

Designed and produced by current students, this catalogue will be distributed to leading art connoisseurs and trendsetters nation and world wide. As a publication it will be a strong source of innovative and creative reference in its own right - also in years to come.

This is your chance to make your name known to this creative community!

story:
About Me

Anna Thomas is an artist currently living in Oklahoma. She graduated from the University of Oklahoma in May, 2013 with her undergrad in Studio Art in Sculpture and Painting with a minor in Art History. She just finished a year long Artist Residency with the Office of Arts & Cultural in the Planning Department of the City of Oklahoma City. Before she goes to France for her Artist Residency with CAMAC, a creative center offering international residency programs for artists, scientists and technologists working with new media, she will complete a summer internship working for JB Public Art in Tucson, AZ. 

Anna will attend Graduate School in 2015 to obtain a Masters in Landscape Architecture. She will couple this knowledge with her work in sculpture to create large outdoor Public Art and design Public Spaces. 

Why this? Why now?

This campaign is extremely important to my career because it will allow me to work on a scale that I've never been able to before. I will live in a place without any distractions, surrounded by new people that wish for the same thing as I do: to create something that ignites a new direction in their work and in their life. 

By contributing to my campaign YOU will have a hand in allowing someone to follow their dreams. I want to enhance people’s lives with art and quality outdoor design in order to foster a better community. This is one step of many that I will undergo to ensure that I will achieve my goals in enriching our communities.

$$$ Facts

I am asking for $4000.00.

  $1800.00 will go to the remaining residency fee (this includes room and board for         1 month and equipment)

  $1500.00 will go to my round trip flight to France

  $500 for purchasing materials

  $200 for trains to get from Paris to CAMAC

Your Perks

All gifts are designed and fabricated by Anna Thomas

If you donate $15 you will get a handmade collage postcard.

If you donate $50 you will get a postcard with a drawing of you or whomever you choose.

If you donate $100 you will get a small-scale 2D wire sculpture.

If you donate $200 you will get a 3D iron rod sculpture (small scale) and signed print of the finished piece.

If you donate $400 you will get 3D iron rod sculpture (small scale), signed print of the finished piece, and a piece of natural material from France encased in resin.

If you can't donate (and even if you can) please help me spread the word by posting my campaign to your facebook, emailing to your friends, etc. Every dollar counts!

Thank you all so much for you support!!

Anna's blog of her work

CAMAC Website

story:
Hello!

We are MeetFactory, an international centre of contemporary art, whose mission is to support and help develop contemporary art and bring it to the public. MeetFactory was founded in 2001 by the artist David Černý, who intended it to become a platform that would enable Prague to join the international art scene and also wanted to run an independent international cultural centre.

MeetFactory facilitates the development of original projects and events for next to nothing of free of charge. It is a space, where people and various art forms such as art, music, theatre, film, photography and literature meet and overlap. In brings together different art groups and generations.

More info: www.meetfactory.cz

We are currently planning an exhibition called "Pussy Riot and the Russian Tradition of Art Rebellion", which will take place on the 7th of January in our main gallery - MeetFactory Gallery. 

The exhibition is dedicated to aesthetic aspects of the oppression-struggling creative act: street art-vandalism, ridiculing flashmobs, clownish posed photos, parodic video clips, idiotic role games in urban environment or costume personage performance realized in Russian art for the first time in the last 30 years and reflected in the performances and video clips of Pussy Riot band. The show features such distinguished artists and art groups as Oleg Kulik, Boris Orlov, Gnezdo band, Rostislav Lebedev, Blue Noses group, Avdey Ter-Oganyan or Voina group.

Exhibiting artists: Vika Begalskaja (RU), Blue Noses Group (RU), Alexander Brener (RU), Dmitri Bulnigin (RU), Elikuka Group (RU), E.T.I. Group (RU), Gnezdo Group (RU), Alexey Iorsh (RU), Komar a Melamid (RU), Alexander Kosolapov (RU), Oleg Kulik (RU), Rostislav Lebedev (RU), Victoria Lomasko (RU), Artem Loskutov (RU), Vladislav Mamishev Monroe (RU), Igor Mukhin (RU), Boris Orlov (RU), PG Group (RU), Pussy Riot (RU), Leonid Sokov (RU), Tcvetophory Group (RU), Voina Group (RU)

What do we need to make this exhibition happen:

a/ to cover the travel expenses for 3 people from Moscow and Paris to Prague and back; transportation expences for art pieces (1800 USD)

b/ accommodation (300 USD)

c/ exhibition brochure, posters and postcards, video (1000 USD)

d/ advertising campaign (600 USD)

What do you get from us?

Let us make you famous by inserting your name  into our short exhibition document (in the final subtitles).

Get a unique MeetFactory T-shirt or send a special postcard direct to president Putin!

And finally come to Prague and be our guest. Discover the creative spirit of Prague´s artistic underground! Have a delicious dinner at a restaurant owned by Václav Havel´s chef and accept an invitation from David Černý as your personal cultural guide.

And above all your donated credit will help us to run the exhibition!

When this exhibition begins, it will be almost a year from the performance of Pussy Riot in the Christ the Savior cathedral in Moscow. Perhaps even more interesting than the performance itself was the spectacular media coverage and attention of not only the global art world, that came right after this event and lasts until now. The Pussy Riot action and its consequences for the group members were seen from all kinds of different perspectives, from heroization through using them as a means for expressing anti-Putin statements to thinking of this move as a mere promotion of the now famous artistic and musical group. However, this act was rarely contextualized, seen a part of a larger whole.

The exhibition concept for Prague became larger, looking at performances and actions dating back to the 1970s, which obviously still relate to contemporary events. We are pleased to present this exhibition and would be grateful for your support.

We hope this exhibiton to be very attractive for Czech people and also for international visitors.The history of 40 years of suffering under the communistic regime in East Europe is still alive in our mind. From 1948 throught 1986 untill 1989, we survived and artitst were one of the most important voices of movements and changes. 

AS VÁCLAV HAVEL SAYS: „We shouldn´t forget anyone, who have paid for our freedome in some way or other.“ WE ARE TRYING THIS EVERY DAY, WHOLE LIFE.

Thank you for your help, we really appreciate it!

With love

The MeetFactory team

story:
THE POET

The official bio reads as follows:

  • Jaz Sufi is a poet, a Bay Area Native, an excavator of the human condition, and delighted to make your acquaintance. At 18, she became the slammaster of the Legendary Santa Cruz Indie Slam and the youngest slammaster of a PSI-certified venue in the country. Later that year, she assistant coached her team to place 8th at the 2011 National Poetry Slam, and in 2012 competed as part of Stockton's debut national team. At Inkslam '12, she was invited to encore on final stage after being voted by the audience as one of the festival's top performances. She was a featured poet at the 2011 USF Creative Justice Art Show, and has been invited to perform at festivals across the Bay, including San Jose's 2011/2012 SubZero Festival, San Francisco's How Weird Street Faire, and Santa Cruz's Poetry and Book Arts Extravaganza. Sometimes Jaz is sad in her poems, and that's fine, but sometimes she's not, and that's fine, too.

This doesn't get to the heart of things, however. I went to my first slam the week after my seventeenth birthday, and six hours after yet another relapse into self-harm. I wore long sleeves. I sat in the corner. I did everything possible to be nothing -- and was randomly selected as a judge. I haven't gone two weeks without attending or competing in a slam since. I've found family I didn't even know I was missing before hearing them read. Slam taught me that it was okay to feel loud enough for an entire audience to feel it, too; that my words and my stories were valid and worth hearing; that sometimes the world listens to a single voice. The first time you step on a stage, it is impossible to ever be nothing again.

 

THE COMPETITION     

Slam poetry is a form of competitive spoken word originating in Chicago during the '80s. Judges are chosen randomly from the audience to score each poem from 1 to 10. Poets are given a time limit (between one and four minutes, but most often three) and a few general rules -- no props, no costumes, no assaulting low-scoring judges -- and make magic from the microphone.  The poetry has always been and will always be the point, of course, but only one can win. It's basically like a friendly version of the Hunger Games.

The Women of the World Poetry Slam (WOWPS) is one of three national tournaments held by Poetry Slam Incorporated. Each year, up to 72 female-identified poets compete at this four day event to decide the top female poet in the nation. WOWPS 2013 will take place in Minneapolis, MN from March 6th to 10th.

 

THE PROBLEM

... as always, is money. Unfortunately, Delta Airlines doesn't accept a poem and a winning smile as payment. The breakdown is as follows:

  • airplane ticket = $482
  • hotel = $400
  • registration = $150
  • IndieGoGo fees = $70+
  • printing/shipping costs = $30-50

I'm a poet, so all numbers tend to frighten me, but these numbers in particular frighten me a lot. As an unemployed full-time student, they're positively terrifying. I'll put myself in the poorhouse to get to WOWPS, but I'd prefer that not to be the case, particularly since I have the sneaking suspicion poorhouses don't actually exist anymore.

 

THE SOLUTION

... is you! My appreciation for every single dollar is almost blinding in its size and authenticity. The perks are less an incentive to donate and more a way to show you just how grateful I am.

If you can't donate in dollars, a second of your time is just as valuable. Tell a friend. Tell ALL your friends. Tell an enemy. Tell ALL your enemies. Tell Facebook and Twitter and your auntie and the mailman. Minneapolis is a long, long ways away, and the more people who hear about this, the more people might be willing to toss a dollar or two my way.

(Here are examples of the perks, in case you want to see what you're in for. More photos will be added over the course of the month).

story:
I am Ajith Prasad (Aji), an Artist, Designer, dreamer, traveler, and process worker. I live in India, not particularly in any house or place, but in India.

I was born in a small village in Kerala, India. Though I went on to study Engineering in 1987, in 1989 I found myself much more interested in photography, theater, painting, and all things that revolve around inner life, meanings, and purposes.

Since then I have been painting and exhibiting. This work played a very significant role in transforming my self, my world view, and many things around my life. During this period, I wrote a few plays and directed them.

Today I continue to paint, photograph, design, and write; and as i write this i am sitting with an intense need to make 3 films, a game, and a lot of paintings.

I am trying to raise funds for my current art projects. My wish is to fund my future projects using my past work, with the support of all who appreciate my work and would like to see more work flowing from me. It is very important for me to do it this way, since my future work will also have the will, the wish, and the blessings of all of you.

My Work

Though my works appear to be paintings, they are also sculptures. And is done on photographic paper that was thrown out of print labs as waste, since they were accidentally exposed to white light. I would pick them up- the surface appears black but has minute layers beneath it - and scrape out (process of sculpting) layers using a blade. 

Process of doing this work.. 

1. when photographic paper is exposed to white light and processed, it turns black, but its four layers of emulsion assumes different colors such as black, red, yellow and white. each layer is about 1 by 100th of a millimeter thick 


2. I pick up exposed photographic paper and work on it with a blade by sculpting out minute layers to create the work of art 

3. no external colours are added to it....

 

 

Philosophically it is both a painting and a sculpture, as a friend of mine puts it "both masculine and feminine - ardha nareshwar". To me when I am working I am adding stokes of light into the darkness and discovering what light shows. in all my works beyond all the imagery, there is a state, a universe of emotions, and it is that i paint and sculpt.

I am offering art prints of few of my works, which are very dear to me. Besides funding, it helps the work also to be seen.

Need for funds

I am primarily trying to raise seed funds for two of my future project.

1. "The Gift" a film 

2. "Journey" a game

To add to it I am currently also working on paintings (a series)-- "wandering lines" and "riots of vision". These projects are extremely important for me, especially the game, I believe it will change the way we tell stories..

 

My Projects

Story line of "The Gift"
A man is going to be a father, he is obsessed with the idea of finding a unique gift for the new member, it is the story of his journey to find the gift, a story that spans 10 months of pregnancy, it is a journey through different layers of transformations

i would like to make this movie from your contributions.. your gifts... it is also a journey on what the state of pregnancy means for a man, and the hope of falling in love with the same person again and again.

"Journey"
Is a game of life and living, the way stories are told and listened to.... i believe it will be beginning of a new paradigm for gaming

How the funds will be used ? 

This fund will be used primarily for travel, research, art supplies and writing the Game Bible. The film and game will seek further crowd funding at different stages of its making. 

If I am not able to raise what I wish to, the fund raised will be used to create more works and campaign again and again with new works, till i have enough to complete the projects, and part of it will also be used to contribute to other campaigns related to art, literature, and environment.

What You Get

Contributors Will Recieve the perks & be thanked on my page and in credits of the Film. and updated on the progress of projects.

I might find a good actor, actress, singer, composer, dancer, intimate friend, cinematographer, and so on.. among you.

Perk 1: Post Cards $ 25

A pack of six postcards (6 x 4 size) of my works. (see the gallery for bigger images)


Perk 2: Art Prints $ 100

A pack of six Art Prints 8 x 10 size (limited edition) + Post cards (see the gallery for bigger images)

 

Perk 3:Signed Art Prints $ 250

A set of six Art Prints 8 x 10 size signed by the artist (limited edition)+ Post cards (see the gallery for bigger images)

 

 

Perk 4: Signed art print on canvas $ 500

Signed art print on canvas, of one of the following works (please mention your choice) + Post cards (see the gallery for bigger images)

 

"vision" printed on canvas and signed. (limited edition)

 

"laugh" printed on canvas and signed. (limited edition)

 

"untitled" printed on canvas and signed. (limited edition)

 

"bull" printed on canvas and signed. (limited edition)

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me to promote this campaign by sharing it on facebook, twitter and other social media.

Sharing the campaign to your personal contacts.

Send me your blessings and love.

Please promote :)

 

Beyond this campaign

I might find a good actor, actress, singer, composer, dancer, intimate friend, cinematographer, and so on.... among you ... 

Big hug to all of you..
story_txt:
I am Ajith Prasad (Aji), an Artist, Designer, dreamer, traveler, and process worker. I live in India, not particularly in any house or place, but in India.I was born in a small village in Kerala, India. Though I went on to study Engineering in 1987, in 1989 I found myself much more interested in photography, theater, painting, and all things that revolve around inner life, meanings, and purposes.
Since then I have been painting and exhibiting. This work played a very significant role in transforming my self, my world view, and many things around my life. During this period, I wrote a few plays and directed them.
Today I continue to paint, photograph, design, and write; and as i write this i am sitting with an intense need to make 3 films, a game, and a lot of paintings.
I am trying to raise funds for my current art projects. My wish is to fund my future projects using my past work, with the support of all who appreciate my work and would like to see more work flowing from me. It is very important for me to do it this way, since my future work will also have the will, the wish, and the blessings of all of you.
My Work
Though my works appear to be paintings, they are also sculptures. And is done on photographic paper that was thrown out of print labs as waste, since they were accidentally exposed to white light. I would pick them up- the surface appears black but has minute layers beneath it - and scrape out (process of sculpting) layers using a blade. 
Process of doing this work.. 
1. when photographic paper is exposed to white light and processed, it turns black, but its four layers of emulsion assumes different colors such as black, red, yellow and white. each layer is about 1 by 100th of a millimeter thick 

2. I pick up exposed photographic paper and work on it with a blade by sculpting out minute layers to create the work of art 3. no external colours are added to it....

 
 
Philosophically it is both a painting and a sculpture, as a friend of mine puts it "both masculine and feminine - ardha nareshwar". To me when I am working I am adding stokes of light into the darkness and discovering what light shows. in all my works beyond all the imagery, there is a state, a universe of emotions, and it is that i paint and sculpt.
I am offering art prints of few of my works, which are very dear to me. Besides funding, it helps the work also to be seen.
Need for funds
I am primarily trying to raise seed funds for two of my future project.
1. "The Gift" a film 
2. "Journey" a game
To add to it I am currently also working on paintings (a series)-- "wandering lines" and "riots of vision". These projects are extremely important for me, especially the game, I believe it will change the way we tell stories..

"Journey"Is a game of life and living, the way stories are told and listened to.... i believe it will be beginning of a new paradigm for gaming

This fund will be used primarily for travel, research, art supplies and writing the Game Bible. The film and game will seek further crowd funding at different stages of its making. 
If I am not able to raise what I wish to, the fund raised will be used to create more works and campaign again and again with new works, till i have enough to complete the projects, and part of it will also be used to contribute to other campaigns related to art, literature, and environment.

story:
An English Video will be here soon

Un peu sur moi!

Bonjour! Mon nom est Nadia Guillemette, je suis une artiste peintre impressionniste abstraite de 41 ans. Je vis à la campagne avec mon homme Patrick et mon chat Charlie au Canada. Je suis frisée comme un mouton et passionnée de la vie. J’ai toujours été artiste, depuis toute petite, crayons, pinceaux, peintures était mes meilleurs amis du monde. 

Depuis 4 ans, je trime dure pour me faire reconnaitre de mes paires. C’est difficile dans ce milieu surtout quand tu ne passes pas par les chemins conventionnel de l’école. J’ai une chance enfin de passer de l’autre côté de la clôture. En juillet dernier ma candidature a été retenue par le SIDIM, c’est le salon international de Design de Montréal. En mai 2014, j’y serai pour me faire connaitre d’avantage ce qui me permettra d’avancer dans ma carrière d’artiste. Car mes 2 plus grands rêves sont: de faire mon métier à temps plein, fini les 2 jobs pour survivre, l’autre c’est d’exposer au Musée des arts contemporain de Montréal mon projet qui se nomme NORMAL. Je vous en reparle en temps et lieu celui-là c’est du long terme et c'est le retour sur les bancs de l'université avant.

A little bit about MOI!

Hi! Thanks for taking the time to read about me.  My name is Nadia Guillemette, I'm an impressionist abstract painter of 41 years young.  I live in the country with my partner Patrick and our cat Charlie in Canada.

 I have crazy curly hair and passionate about life.  I have been an artiste all my life, little, my best friends were the jars of paint, some crayons and a brush.

It’s been 4 years now that I have been working very hard to get recognized by my peers. In this career it’s hard, very hard even more so when you don't go through the conventional path of school. Next may 2014 I will have a great opportunity to meet my peers, designer, buyer etc.  I was chosen to do the International design show in Montreal called SIDIM.  This is going to help me get where I want to go in life. The first: stop working two jobs and concentrate on just one, which is painting. Then the other one is to get a show at the Montreal museum of contemporary art for my project call NORMAL but that is a whole new story as I will have to go back to university first.

 

Le projet

Le SIDIM, est le rendez-vous annuel des professionnels de toutes les industries reliées au design, à l’architecture, à la construction ainsi qu’aux consommateurs passionnés de design depuis 25 ans. www.sidim.com

  . Présence de 400 représentants des médias

  . Pouvoir d’achat et de recommandation des visiteurs : 1,286 milliard

  . Plus de 100 acheteurs internationaux ciblés présents à l’évènement

  . Plus de 32% des visiteurs ont un revenu de ménage supérieur à 100 000$

  . 2 jours réservés aux professionnels de l’industrie et 2 jours au public.

  

The SIDIM is an annual rendezvous of professionals of all the industries related to design, architecture and construction.  www.sidim.com.

.Presence of 400 medias representation

More the 100 international buyers

2 days reserved for professional of the industries and 2 days open to the public.

 

Comment ça sera dépensé. How I'm going to spend this

 

Porte folio

Je vais engager un photographe professionnel pour prendre mes œuvres en photo. Je vais pouvoir me servir de ça, afin de  les montrer en continue sur un laptop Asus Tablette que je dois acheter, durant les 4 jours et faire aussi un catalogue que je remettrais en cadeau pour ceux qui ferons une donations de 25$ et plus.

I will get a professional photographer to take pictures of my art. So I can make a video that will be shown on a laptop Asus Tablet that I have to buy, for the 4 days and I will print a catalogue that will be given to anybody who will give a donation of $25 or more.

Transport

Location d’un mini van pour apporter mes œuvres au Studio et au Salon. Je travaille sur du gros format 4x3 pied et plus. Mes œuvres ne rentrent pas dans ma voiture, du moins pas toutes.

Leasing of a mini-van for the transport of the art, to and from the event. Unfortunately I work on large format of 4 x 3 feet canvas and they just don't fit in my car.

Kiosque

Va m'aider à payer le stand 3000.00$ +tx.

Will help me pay for the stand. It's 3000$ +tx.

Matériel bruts et location d’espace de travail. Studio rental and materiels

Malheureusement mon atelier n’est pas chauffé alors je ne travaille pas l’hiver. J’aimerais continuer ma production pour cet évènement. Alors je dois louer un local et c'est dispendieux, en moyenne 1200.00$ par mois.  Tout le matériel que j'ai besoin, lame pour couper les palettes, marteau, clou, peintures, montant etc...

Unfortunately my studio is not heated for winter so I cannot work from November to May.  Since I have to work this winter to be ready for the show, I will have to rent a heated studio for 4 months and also buy all the material I need for my work

Un don= un cadeau

One donation= One gift

Vous avez toute ma gratitude, ce projet serait beaucoup plus difficile sans vous, il va se faire pareille c’est certain,  mais je vais être obligée de faire une ou deux soirée spaghetti.

Chaque don sera honoré par un cadeau : une carte de souhait, une carte postale authentique, une toile 5x7, 8x10 ou 11x14 pouces ou une toile de 4 x 3 pieds etc… c’est le montant de votre don qui déterminera le cadeau qui vous sera remis durant l’année 2014.

 

First and for most THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU. You have all of my gratitude. Every donation will be honored by a gift. From a simple hand maid card, or a mail art postcard to a 5x7’’, 8x10’, or a 11x14’, even a 4 x 3 feet original work of art.  Your donation will determine the gift. 

Comment vous pouvez m’aider en un simple click.

1. Investir à mon projet.

2. Partager mon projet partout, partout, partout avec tout le monde.

Il est dit dans la vie que ça prend un village pour élever un enfant. Soyez mon village.

How can you help me with a simple click.

1. Invest in my project

2. Share my project with everyone and anyone you know

 They say that it takes a village to raise someone, please be mine 

 

REMERCIEMENT TOUT PARTICULIER

A Daniel-Claude pour la vidéo et la jasette qui m’aide à mettre mes idées en ordre.

George www.george@aethon.net pour son aide technique et un site web incroyable.

Josée pour la correction de mes textes pour ce projet.

A mon homme sans lui rien n’est possible.

A tous ceux de près et de loin qui m’ont encouragé dans mon aventure.

 

MY SPECIAL THANKS TO:

My friend Daniel-Claude for the video and the talks.

My friend George www.george@aethon.net for the technical support and a kickass website.

Josée for the correction of all my text for this project.

My Main squeeze without him nothing would be possible.

And all of you who have been there all those year watching me grow.

story:
Hello!

My name is Desiree Baker and I'm an artist living in St. Johns, NL. I've been painting since an early age, having studied watercolour and acrylic under local artist Patricia Ryan for many years. I began painting with ink four years ago and developed my own style that fluctuates between abstract and design elements. 

My campaign is to raise money towards the cost of tuition for a three week art intensive in Italy this July. It is so important to me because I will be given the opportunity for great artistic growth- my life blood, my career! I will be painting 6 days a week, 7 hours a day with masters of visionary art. I will be sweating and crying and vibrating with art. It will be more than just another day in an art classroom. 

I am fundraising to cover the cost of my tuition $2900. The money I raise will go directly to cover this cost whether I reach my goal or not. If I raise more than the cost of my tuition, the extra money will be given to charity. 

The perks! There are perks for your contribution! Are you excited? I'm excited!

For $5 you get a surprise from my tickle trunk of treasures! Be prepared to be surprised, shocked or delighted!

For $15 you get a mix CD with badass tunes sure to please!

For $25 you can choose between my artwork printed on a magnet or a bookmark. This print will be limited to the fundraiser. One time deal folks!

For $40 you receive a mug with my artwork printed on it. Like the magnet/bookmark, the particular print on the mug will be limited to this fundraiser! 

At the $50 mark you will receive a one of a kind 4x4" original created just for you!

For $75 you can combine any of the smaller perks to the value of $50 plus I will personalize one of my art cards with a message or poem that I wrote!

At $100 you will receive a 1.5 hour art lesson from yours truly!

Also at the $100 you can receive a metallic print of one of my prints in limited edition- limited to this fundraiser. 

For $150 I will take you for a night out on the town as your wingman or dance partner! Testimonials for my moves and grooves can be provided! 

For $250 you can combine any of the smaller perks up to the value of $200 plus a personalized video message will be sent to you that really is... priceless...

For $500 I will create a custom 8x10" one of a kind original just for you!

For the big one, $1000, I will create a custom 12x16" one of a kind original just for you!

Your contribution will help make a dream come true! 

If you can't make a contribution but you would like to help please share my campaign on your social media sites like Facebook and Twitter. Good karma will be sent your way!

A big thank you from my heart!

story:
2012 marks the 10th anniversary of Cité des Arts - South Louisiana's premiere community arts "Incubator". To celebrate this milestone, we will be hosting the first annual SteamPunk Festival in culturally rich Lafayette, LA.

Who Are We?

Cité des Arts is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit arts and education organization and community facility that has been providing affordable space for a wide variety of arts activities for 10 years in downtown Lafayette: performances, rehearsals, recitals, workshops, classes, showcases, presentations, film screenings and premieres, as well as, community meetings, conferences and initiatives.  With two professionally equipted theatres, dance studio, music room, art gallery, Flying Saucer Cafe, and costume room, the list of art and educational services and benefits to the communidty is too long for here, but visit our website to see all that happens at Cité des Arts.  http://citedesarts.org

What's the Project?

The SteamPunk Festival will bring a fun-packed creative event, celebrating all forms of arts. Steam punk is a literary genre - a multidimensional view of the world.  It is past, present, and future. It is romantic, yet, it is science, history, literature and art. It is time travel and about invention - out of the box industrial. The clothing is the-late-1800’s-meets-the-future.
 
We have chosen this theme to celebrate Cite de Arts’ 10th anniversary because Steampunk showcases such a broad spectrum of creative activity. We plan on having music, art, juggling, magic, puppets, tarot readings, old tintype photography, tattoo art, stilt walkers, a fashion show, and much more. In the evening, the musical "Cabaret" will be in our main theatre with a live band. We like to think the future of Cite Des Arts is much like SteamPunk with all of the creativity - the inventions, bells & whistles and frills. We hope to pull together our community's family of artists to create a festival this year and into the future that surpasses anything that Lafayette has seen.
 
What's the money for?

The day-long festival is set to feature indoor and outdoor activities. We are looking to raise a total of $5050 and your financial contribution will ensure the success of the festival by assisting Cité des Arts to close down Vine Street, set up a stage and tents, host a couple bands and create a street fair/festival atmosphere with secure places for vendors and sideshows - pay for printing, the permit to close off Vine Street and for official city traffic barriers, an outdoor stage and a professional sound setup, and outdoor tents. And, we want to pay all the professional artists who are working for the festival.
 
As a 501(c)3 non-profit, connumity-based organization, transparency is one of our core values and our financial statements are maintained by and available from our board of directors.  Our SteamPunk Festival is a community-led, non-profit project, and all contributions are made on a voluntary basis and each contributor is regarded as an integral part of the festival. What binds us all is a common passion for promoting quality of life through the arts, education and participation. 
 
If you have ideas on how else you can contribute to Cité des Arts, please contact us at info@citedesarts.org – we greatly welcome your suggestions and look forward to hearing from you.We hope to celebrate this important occasion with you on the 10th November here in exotic South Louisiana, downtown Lafayette.
 
In the meantime, we’d like to extend a huge thank you for your help and generosity. Y'all come see us anytime!
 
With warm wishes,
The Cité des Arts team
story_txt:
2012 marks the 10th anniversary of Cité des Arts - South Louisiana's premiere community arts "Incubator". To celebrate this milestone, we will be hosting the first annual SteamPunk Festival in culturally rich Lafayette, LA.

Who Are We?
Cité des Arts is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit arts and education organization and community facility that has been providing affordable space for a wide variety of arts activities for 10 years in downtown Lafayette: performances, rehearsals, recitals, workshops, classes, showcases, presentations, film screenings and premieres, as well as, community meetings, conferences and initiatives.  With two professionally equipted theatres, dance studio, music room, art gallery, Flying Saucer Cafe, and costume room, the list of art and educational services and benefits to the communidty is too long for here, but visit our website to see all that happens at Cité des Arts.  http://citedesarts.org
What's the Project?

The SteamPunk Festival will bring a fun-packed creative event, celebrating all forms of arts. Steam punk is a literary genre - a multidimensional view of the world.  It is past, present, and future. It is romantic, yet, it is science, history, literature and art. It is time travel and about invention - out of the box industrial. The clothing is the-late-1800’s-meets-the-future.
 
We have chosen this theme to celebrate Cite de Arts’ 10th anniversary because Steampunk showcases such a broad spectrum of creative activity. We plan on having music, art, juggling, magic, puppets, tarot readings, old tintype photography, tattoo art, stilt walkers, a fashion show, and much more. In the evening, the musical "Cabaret" will be in our main theatre with a live band. We like to think the future of Cite Des Arts is much like SteamPunk with all of the creativity - the inventions, bells & whistles and frills. We hope to pull together our community's family of artists to create a festival this year and into the future that surpasses anything that Lafayette has seen.
 
What's the money for?

The day-long festival is set to feature indoor and outdoor activities. We are looking to raise a total of $5050 and your financial contribution will ensure the success of the festival by assisting Cité des Arts to close down Vine Street, set up a stage and tents, host a couple bands and create a street fair/festival atmosphere with secure places for vendors and sideshows - pay for printing, the permit to close off Vine Street and for official city traffic barriers, an outdoor stage and a professional sound setup, and outdoor tents. And, we want to pay all the professional artists who are working for the festival.
 
As a 501(c)3 non-profit, connumity-based organization, transparency is one of our core values and our financial statements are maintained by and available from our board of directors.  Our SteamPunk Festival is a community-led, non-profit project, and all contributions are made on a voluntary basis and each contributor is regarded as an integral part of the festival. What binds us all is a common passion for promoting quality of life through the arts, education and participation. 
 
If you have ideas on how else you can contribute to Cité des Arts, please contact us at info@citedesarts.org – we greatly welcome your suggestions and look forward to hearing from you.We hope to celebrate this important occasion with you on the 10th November here in exotic South Louisiana, downtown Lafayette.
 
In the meantime, we’d like to extend a huge thank you for your help and generosity. Y'all come see us anytime!
 
With warm wishes,
The Cité des Arts team

story:
Burning Man 2014 - Bring Hudzo's new zoetrope to life and to the playa!

Update: New Eternal Return Build Timeline & Announcement for Burning Man 2013

We are eager to share the very latest developments with Eternal Return! This is Peter’s most ambitious stroboscopic zoetrope to date, and it has become clear that it is not possible to realize Peter’s vision with just over four months to go until this year’s burn.

Burning Man has offered us an alternative, they have provided a generous grant to bring back multiple pieces in 2013! This is a great opportunity to catch one of your old favorites or see one you may have missed in years passed. This will enable us to bring Eternal Return to it’s full potential in time for Burning Man 2014. We are very grateful for the additional time to produce this unique, inspiring and complex piece and look forward to having your ongoing support as we continue on our journey

In the meantime, we must remain full-steam ahead on the production of Eternal Return and continue our volunteer and fundraising efforts with great momentum. All donations made to this campaign will still go to the build of Eternal Return. We are working not only to meet, but to surpass our Eternal Return Indiegogo fundraising goal. Your contributions thus far have been crucial and we could not be more grateful for your generous donations, countless volunteer hours and continued support. We are thrilled to be able to provide you with two successive years of phenomenal art in return!

**A couple changes to a few of the rewards:
The face casting can be done anytime between May 1, 2013 and Mid-summer 2014. Since Peter will be bringing zoetropes out to the playa in 2013 and 2014, the camp party package will now include an invite for two to both the 2013 and 2014 events. Ditto for the exclusive preview party. All other rewards remain the same.

 

Zoetropes are remarkably qualified to portray the cyclical nature of life. A zoetrope is a cylindrical device that produces the illusion of motion from a rapid succession of static pictures. Instead of drawings and shutters, I use sculptures and strobe lights to achieve the same effect.

Earlier works have focused on darker themes, the Sisyphean drudgery of repetitive, never-ending punishment.  In contrast, Eternal Return celebrates the joy and ecstasy of life, not just repeated, but begun anew. 

The concept of the Eternal Return speculates that the universe has been recurring, and will continue to recur, in a self-similar form, an infinite number of times across infinite time and space. This concept is touched upon in virtually all cultural and religious narratives.

I have been blessed with the opportunity to realize some of my wildest fantasies. And I’d like to have you be part of the next fantasy. Trust me, if you've liked my earlier works, You'll love Eternal Return!

Burning Man has awarded us a very generous grant. However, we still need to raise $40,000 to realize this ambitious design. The creative process begins with the vision of the artist but requires the hands, hearts, and support of a dedicated community to transition from the drawing board to a fully immersive experience. We would be honored if you participated in making this a reality. Your early contributions are essential to the success of Eternal Return.

Thank you very much for your support,

 Follow Eternal Return on Facebook
 
Learn more about Peter's zoetropes at hudzo.com

story:
Short Summary

We are an Austin based Art & Music collective. We provide a unique spotlight for artists and musicians to perform and display their art.

Eventum Obscura5 approaches, it will be our most ambitious event. We want to ensure Eventum Obscura continues to progress and we are raising funds to cover expenditure for holding such an event.

Consistently growing since the first occasion, event goers and artists are offered an up close and personal audience while both the crowd and performer are immersed in an imaginative and vibrant setting that celebrates a wide variety of creative talents.

What We Need & What You Get

Until now we have covered expenses out of pocket. We are setting a goal of $750. With the help of this campaign, we will cover the cost of

  • back-line equipment rental
  • promotional material
  • food and beverage
  • goody bags

We are offering two tier for perks, perks can be picked up at the Eventum Obscura5 on saturday July 13 at Frontir Bar in Austin, TX.

Perks include goody bags with fun souveniers as well as exclusive merchandise from featured artists and musicians.

The Impact

Artistic Variety is important to us and we think others appreciate it too, Eventum Obscura is an evening of arts and entertainment where artists and musicians are provided with a sui generis environment to perform, giving audiences an experience to enjoy and remember.

Every event thus far has consistently been better than the last, we look to continue our ambitious efforts, searching for original and quality art and music to be displayed.

Also, a portion of all funds raised will go to Texas charity Kids In a New Groove, which provides private musical instruction to children in the Texas foster care program.

www.kidsinanewgroove.org

If our goal is met, any additional funds raised will go directly to Kids In a New Groove.

If our goal is not met, not to worry, flexible funding ensures that anything gathered will still go towards Eventum Obscura5 and we will still maintain our promise to charity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Like and share the campaign through word of mouth and social media.

visit www.facebook.com/EventumObscura to see more from Eventum Obscura.

Eventum Obscura5, Saturday July 13, 8pm-2am https://www.facebook.com/events/197342537088113/ hosted by Frontier Bar Austin, TX. Hope to see you all there.

Stay tuned for updates and thank you!!!

story:
“We must remember and continue to tell” 

                                 Dr. Charmaine McKissick-Melton

OUR STORY

Beginning in 2013, 30 diverse community members, ages 15-65, came together during a 16-week period to engage in Durham’s Civil Rights History through a series of lectures, music performances, research and design workshops. The group then gathered what they discovered into a collaborative mural design. In late May-July 2014 these same folks, with the help of the greater community, will paint this 2400 square foot mural in downtown Durham, under the direction of muralist Brenda Miller Holmes. 


Arising from this process is a multimedia, multi platform educational outreach project directed by award-winning documentary filmmaker Rodrigo Dorfman. The stories documented will be personal and thematic, reflecting a painful past and addressing present issues of race and class in a city that is a state of transition and gentrification. These stories will emerge from the design of the mural and the final "story" will go beyond the mural itself into the lives of the characters who participate in this creative process. The documentary material will also be the cornerstone of our educational outreach materials we intend to create to help bring this story and process to other communities in the South.

Please join us and contribute to keep this inspiring history alive and honor the sacrifices of the many Durham citizens who fought for equity and justice. 


 WHAT WE NEED AND WHY

In 2012, our project was selected by the City of Durham, for its first public art pilot program, and we received a generous grant that covered 80% of the initial cost of the mural. Since then, the size of the wall has grown 300%. Our 800 square foot wall is now a 2400 square foot wall! Can you picture that? 

The mural will be located on the rear wall of the Durham Visitors and Convention Center facing Morris Street, next to Durham Arts Council.

While we are really excited about the new downtown location and expanded space, we need more of everything. More paint,  more brushes, more scaffolding…you name it. We also realize the importance of building on this project and reaching as many people as possible about Durham’s profound Civil Rights History, so we are working on a multimedia project to engage community with the history in multiple ways. We need your help! 

First and foremost, we need $7000 to finish the mural. 2400 square feet is a lot of additional space so we require a lot of additional materials, not to mention insurance and expanded scaffolding. We also need $3000 to complete the first documentary phase of our multimedia educational project, which involves filming the creation of the mural and interviewing five participants. The second phase will consist of putting together a short documentary, a booklet and an interactive website. 

 And finally, we need you! Community is central to making this project a reality. Please check out our perks, become an honored sponsor, and donate what you can. 


WHY WE NEED THIS WALL

Our hope for the project is to honor the unsung heroes, while taking a longer view. History is often presented in one top-down dimension that honors leaders and ignores the tremendous efforts of everyday people. Our desire is to depict a fuller history, celebrating the hundreds of Durham Citizens whose feet were on the ground working and to commemorate the incredible sacrifices that they made to create change. I also believe that sharing this history is just as important for looking forward as it is for looking back. Understanding the power of each person’s contribution to collective effort has the potential to inspire new movement as we continue to strive for justice.  

  

GET INVOLVED

“The success of the movement was due to the wisdom of the elders and the impatience of the youth” Mickey Michaux - North Carolina General Assembly

Jhordan Perry, Senator Floyd B. McKissick, Jr.  Dr. Charmaine McKissick-Melton

We also need your time and good humor!  We are inviting the greater community to come and paint with us. Don’t consider yourself an artist? Don’t worry about that, bring your good energy and contribute to this historic public artwork. If this sounds like fun (it is!), please reach out to brenda(at)brendamillerholmes.com and dates will be announced. 

Also, share this campaign via email and social networks. Spread the word and pick up a paint brush. You will not regret it. 


MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT

Funded by the City of Durham, through an initiative of the Durham Cultural Advisory Board, under Durham’s Cultural Master Plan, with additional sponsorship by the Hayti Heritage Center, a diverse group of 30 community members, fifteen youth and fifteen adults, have come together to learn about Durham’s profound Civil Rights History. The project began with a series of educational lectures led by Dr. Benjamin Speller as the education team leader. Dr. Speller served as the Dean of the School of Library and Information Sciences at North Carolina Central University (NCCU) from 1983-2004, is a scholar of Durham Civil Rights History and served as the president of Preservation Durham from 2000-2004. He gathered an incredible teaching team, including North Carolina General Assembly Representative, Mickey Michaux, Executive Director of the Pauli Murray Project, Barbara Lau, Coordinator of University Archives/Instructor of Public History, NCCU, Andre Vann, veteran Civil Rights activist Vivian McCoy, North Carolina Senator Floyd B. McKissick and Department Chair, Mass Communications at NCCU Dr. Charmiane McKissick-Melton. Held in February and March of 2013 at the Hayti Heritage Center, this series was free and open to the public. Following these lectures the participants engaged in additional research and collaborated to create a cohesive mural design under the direction of muralist Brenda Miller Holmes.     

Brenda Miller Holmes is a muralist and art educator that has facilitated collaborative community mural projects throughout the San Francisco Bay Area and internationally and she studied and worked with Master Muralist Susan Cervantes of Precita Eyes Muralists from 2005-2011. Trained in an artistic approach mirroring that of popular education, Brenda’s interest lies at the intersection of art, activism, community empowerment and social justice. She now lives and works in Durham, NC and is passionate about sharing this unifying collaborative creative experience. Beyond mural making, her art teaching experience spans a variety of media and she has led workshops with people of all ages, from toddlers through adults. Check her out at http://www.brendamillerholmes.com 

Rodrigo Dorfman is an award winning filmmaker and multimedia producer who has worked with POV, HBO, Salma Hayek's Ventanazul and the BBC among others.  His films have been screened at some of the top international film festivals in the world (Toronto, Full Frame, Edinburgh, Telluride, Human Rights Watch).  With his father he has won best screenplay award from the Writer's Guild of Great Britain for "Prisoners in Time" (1997).  Rodrigo Dorfman won the Jury Award for Best Short at the Full Frame Film Festival with his jazz doc "One Night in Kernersville"(2011). He is currently developing a documentary-based national museum exhibit with the Levine Museum of the New South on the living history of the Latinos in the South. Check him out at  http://www.melloweb.com

story:
Better, stranger, able to create new art! Kris is an author and professional fiction editor; Scott is a musician and pro audio engineer. Let us assist in your creative projects, to help us fund our own union of creative bliss!

We need your help in order to finally become one creative team. To what will your contributions go? This handy animated donut graph explains:

http://tinyurl.com/frogdonut-youtube

We appreciate contributions at any level. Although you may simply chip in whatever you wish, we are offering various perks utilizing our creative skills. Choices! Choices! Lotsa neato stuff! Check out pics of Scott's kitbash mechs and Kris' jewelry creations in our Gallery. You KNOW you want stuff like that. Hey, even if you can't help financially, please send this around to anyone you know who might be interested in what we're offering. Fling the Frogdonut far and wide!

Note: anyone contributing to our campaign at a higher level who wishes one or more of the perks available at lower contribution levels instead of the perk listed at the higher level should discuss it with us; we’re certainly willing to give out a couple of smaller perks in lieu of one larger one, if you wish! For example: a $100 contributor may wish to have two short stories edited; a $150 contributor might want 2 kitbashes, etc. (Due to time constraints, to keep things fair for all, we do ask that if you're claiming MORE than 2 perks, any after the first two will be moved to the back of the queue.) UK/overseas contributions welcomed; if you want to claim a material perk, we ask that you please contribute at the next higher level in order to cover shipping costs. We’re flexible. Help us bend toward each other, so we can create even better art in a life lived together!

You can view Scott's audio engineering credits here: 

http://scotteraas.blogspot.com/

and Kris' editing credits here:

http://gravewriterediting.blogspot.com/


Every contributor will receive our thanks; anyone providing a snail mail address will receive a handwritten note with a doodle from one or the other of us. We will fulfill all perks in the order that they were requested, starting within a week of the first contributions received. All efforts will be made to fulfill each perk in a timely fashion, first donated/first served. 

Help us create a better situation, working side-by-side as a creative team, and we’ll create stuff for you!

Hey, even if you can't help financially, please send this around to anyone you know who might be interested in what we're offering. Fling the Frogdonut far and wide!Note: anyone contributing to our campaign at a higher level
who wishes one or more of the perks available at lower contribution levels instead of the perk listed at the
higher level should discuss it with us; we’re certainly willing to give out a
couple of smaller perks in lieu of one larger one, if you wish! For example: a
$100 contributor may wish to have two short stories edited; a $150 contributor
might want 2 kitbashes, etc. (Due to time constraints, to keep things fair for
all, we do ask that if you're claiming MORE than 2 perks, any after the first two will be moved to the back of the queue.) UK/overseas contributions welcomed; if you want to claim a material perk, we ask that you please contribute at the next higher level in order to cover shipping costs. We’re
flexible. Help us bend toward each other, so we can create even better art in a
life lived together!You can view Scott's audio engineering credits here: http://scotteraas.blogspot.com/and Kris' editing credits here:http://gravewriterediting.blogspot.com/Every contributor will receive our thanks; anyone providing
a snail mail address will receive a handwritten note with a doodle from one or
the other of us. We will fulfill all perks in
the order that they were requested, starting within a week of the first
contributions received. All efforts will be made to fulfill each perk in a
timely fashion, first donated/first served. Help us create a better situation, working side-by-side as a
creative team, and we’ll create stuff for you!

story:
Short Summary

Simonton Art Refuge is a housing and gallery space to promote local and international artists. There is no rent charged to the artists living at the house and we expect to house 6 to 8 artists full time.

The expected completion time is mid-Summer but we're already housing 3 artists.

What We Need & What You Get

We've collectively put more than 40k of our own dollars into this project but we need your help to heat the house. We recently bought one pellet stove and plan to buy a massive unit before next winter but our residents need more heat now. We are looking to add another small stove and fuel through this campaign while we work on further weatherproofing and saving for a 3rd stove.

If half our goal is reached we can buy a used stove. We're hesitant to do this because the two blowers can cost well over $400 to replace. But if it comes down to it we're prepared to go this route and hope for the best.

The Impact

Mel and Halley don't turn into popsicles.

Other Ways You Can Help

Volunteering time to help fix the roof or weatherproof is an amazing alternative to financial contributions.

Also supporting us by showing up bodily for the artist's shows. The next one is scheduled for the 25th and 26th of January.

story:
Our Story

Hello! We are Justina Zun-Zun Chang and Hollis Marie Maloney! We are creating a gallery exhibition that is to be displayed from July 5th-August 13th ad the SVA Gallery in New York. The reception will be July 7th. The exhibit is titled SPACCCE, Social Possibilities and Creative Connection Communication Exhibition, and essentially it is just that.


The Impact

In today's world, with modern social media and other technological barriers, it's becoming very difficult to connect with one another. SPACCCE plans to facilitate forms of connection, by way of giving/ sharing/ receiving things between people, through which they can develop a deeper level of trust between one another. Even if that level of trust is small, it ignites empathy and allowance for more understanding and compassion, as well as promote positive forms of behavior. The demonstration and interaction of small connections building to more involved connections creates a deeper sense of belonging and a new lasting cycle of trust. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need a bit of money to help us along. Our show requires a great deal of type displayed on walls (which require the production and placement by professional companies), video production and display, print pieces to promote and inform people of the concept and the also show, and many other things. We need about $3500 to cover everything and we REALLY would LOVE your help!


Other Ways You Can Help

And maybe if you can't help, perhaps a friend you know could! Maybe someone else you know would be very interested in the show, and they could help us out with a couple dollars. Or if you just visit our website http://cargocollective.com/spaccce/ and check out or updates and follow along with what we're up to, we'd also love to have you check out the show and tell people about us!
