story:
Short Summary

We are Ashley and Richard Dufresne. We run Imagination Asylum out of our home and are currently trying to expand the business. Last year we had a booth at NYCC for the first time and managed to sell out, as well as get our name out there. This year we have purchased a larger booth at NYCC and are currently finishing up creating our merchandise. We have almost all of the trip funded but we still need some smaller supplies as well as travel expenses. Here is where you can help. 

What We Need & What You Get

We only need $1,500 to fund the rest of our trip as well as supplies. The money we raise will go towards renting a car, gas, hotel and the last of our display supplies for the booth. 

For each donation received there is a tier of perks that you will have the ability to choose from. We have a large variety of perks ranging from our thanks all the way up to one of a kind figures that won't be released to the general public.

Here are the different items you can get:

Art Print:


Islanders:

 Cyglob: 

Poloypsidon:

Meltdown and Sassy are currently being molded and will be complete within the next couple of days. Pictures will be up as soon as the molding is completed. The NYCC exclusive shirt will also have pictures available on the same day. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact us.

If our goal is not fully funded the donations we do receive will still go towards the expenses we have listed previously. Every extra dollar helps. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you want to help us out without a donation all you have to do is spread the word. Just sharing this with your friends can help us immensely. 

    For more about us and what we do feel free to visit our website: Imaginationasylum.com or contacts us at rich@imaginationasylum.com.

story:
In February WalkerStalker Con came to London for the first time, and as an artist with a table on artist alley I offered my zombie fuelled artwork.  In July I'll be attending UK HorrorCon in Sheffield and intend to create 8 extra designs to compliment the 12 already created. This is a small scale project to allow me to create these extra zombie designs to compliment my current designs.


I have 12 zombie themed art nouveau pieces, divided into 2 sets of 6, already designed and printed, but I'd love to add 4 more designs to each set.  I'll be working on these extra designs whilst the campaign is running and will be posting updates.
This campaign is to cover some of the printing costs for these extra designs, as well as to pay for my time in creating them. 


Postcards are approx 4" x 6" on heavyweight, Matt laminated card and are dispatched sealed

So as well as the 6 existing designs in each set, each set will also include FOUR additional designs, the artwork for which will be posted in updates as they are completed! 

Thanks for reading, and hope we can successfully reach our goal!

story:
Support the first ever Midburn Post Trauma Post Office!

English follows

שימו לב תומכי הדואר- לוחצים על כפתור)

Pay with Paypal

(ובמסך הבא לבחור בתשלום עם כ. אשראי

תמכו בהקמת סניף הדואר הראשון במידברן!

אנחנו לא סתם אנשים עם קרניים – אנחנו אנשים עם חזון

במאי 2015, למשך 5 ימים ולילות, נקים במדבר סניף דואר אמיתי ורשמי שייקח את כל תושבי העיר הזמנית למסע צבעוני ומוטרף בנבכי הביורוקרטיה! 

בסניף הדואר של מידברן תוכלו לשלוח מכתבים, גלויות ומזכרות מהפלאיה – כן כן, מכתבים אמתיים שיגיעו בשלום לכל מקום שתרצו מחוץ לפלאיה! 

תוכלו לקבל מכתבים מלאי געגוע מעצמכם, לשלוח מברקים מזמרים, לקבל חבילות מפתיעות מאנשים שמעולם לא פגשתם, לשלם קנסות על פשעים שלא ביצעתם ולקבל את כל המידע שאתם לא צריכים לדעת. וזה לא הכל. 

סניף הדואר "פוסט טראומה" - ישאיר עליכם חותם. מבטיחים.

מי זה אנחנו 

לרגל הקמת סניף הדואר הראשון במידברן 2015 התאחדו נשים ואנשים שמבינים דבר או שניים בביורוקרטיה, בעיצוב גלויות ובולים, במילים, במכתבים, בשירים ובשרירים -  והקימו את מחנה הנושא: דואר – פוסט טראומה. 

אנחנו דוורים ודווריות שישנו לנצח את מה שחשבתם על דואר. ועל הצבי. ועל ערק.  

נכון שאתם רוצים מזכרת שתישאר אתכם אחרי שהאבק יישקע? בול!

בימים אלה אנחנו עובדים, בשיתוף פעולה של אמנים ורשות הדואר הישראלית, על הפקת מהדורה מוגבלת של בולים מעוצבים וייחודיים למידברן 2015. 

זה ה- בול שתרצו שילווה את המכתב שתשלחו הביתה. זו ה- מזכרת שכל מידברנר ירצה להדביק באלבום הבולים הפרטי או להוריש לנכדיו. כדי לשמור על ייחודיות - הבול ייצא ב-2015 עותקים בלבד. כל מי שיחזיק בו יחזיק פיסה מההיסטוריה! 

כ-6,000 תושבים יבקרו השנה בעיר הזמנית ורק 1/3 מהם יזכו להחזיק בבולים הנדירים – 

הבטיחו את הבול שלכם מבעוד מועד.

?הגעתם עד כאן ואתם לא יודעים מה זה מידברן 

בין ה- 20-24/5 צפויים כ- 6000 אנשים להפוך לתושבים בעיר מדבר זמנית – למלא אותה בתוכן, באמנות, במוסיקה ובטירוף חושים מוחלט. מחנות נושא הם לב ליבה של העיר.  

אנחנו חלק מ- 6,000 התושבים, נרגשים ליצור את מחנה דואר – פוסט טראומה: 

סניף הדואר הראשון באירוע מידברן 2015 ומזמינים אתכם לתמוך במימוש הרעיון שלנו!

?קאט דה בול: איך אתם יכולים לעזור 

יצירת סניף דואר פעיל, מעוצב ומלא בתוכן, בחומרים בירוקרטיים שלא תרצו להשליך, והפתעות שלא תשכחו, הפקת מהדורת הבולים הראשונה באלפי עותקים, הדפסה של אלפי גלויות מעוצבות וייחודיות – כל אלה עולים לא מעט. לא מעט בכלל. 

אתם, לעומת זאת, יכולים לתמוך מעט ולעזור לנו להעניק לעיר מתנה גדולה. 

התמיכה שלכם תשמש לעיצוב ובניית התפאורה של סניף הדואר, לעיצוב והדפסת הבולים, הגלויות, החומרים הביורוקרטיים הנוספים ולעוד הפתעות שהיינו מגלים לכם, אבל זו לא תהיה הפתעה. 

סכום התמיכה המינימלי עומד על 5 דולר בלבד, כך שכל אחד ואחת מכם יכולים לקחת חלק!

בסוף הארוע נפרסם דו"ח שקיפות על השימוש בכספים

התשורות כולן נהדרות ואתם מוזמנים לאסוף אותן אצלנו במחנה הדואר

 

לא מגיעים השנה למידברן? תוכלו כמובן לתמוך בהקמת סניף הדואר והפקת בול מידברן גם אם לא תגיעו השנה למידברן - ולאפשר לנו להעניק מזכרת (או חוויה טראומטית) לתושבי העיר. 

עפתם מהרעיון אבל לא יכולים לתמוך? לא נורא! תוכלו לשתף את הפרויקט ולהזמין חברים לתמוך. 

ואל תשכחו לבוא לבקר אותנו בסניף הדואר! 

Support the first ever Midburn Post Trauma Post Office!

We're not just a bunch of guys with horns - we have a vision!

In May 2015, for 5 days and nights, we'll establish a real life, formal, desert post office which will take the temporary city residents on a colorful and crazy journey into the depths of bureaucracy!

At Midburn's Post Trauma Post Office you'll be able to send letters, postcards and souvenirs from the Playa - indeed, real letters which will arrive safely anywhere you want outside or inside the Playa!

You'll be able to receive a love letter from yourself, send singing telegrams, get surprising packages from people you've never met, pay fines for crimes you didn't commit and get all the information you never needed to know. And that's not all.

The Post Trauma Post Office will leave its mark on you. We promise.

So who are we?

For the occasion of the establishment of the first post office in Midburn 2015, we have come together, women and men, who know a thing or two about bureaucracy, designing postcards and stamps, words, letters, poems, and some other stuff - and have established the theme camp: Post Trauma Post Office .

We are the post-men and women who will forever change anything and everything you thought about snail mail. And Araq.

Wouldn't you just love to have a stamp of proof that you were actually at Midburn? A souvenir that'll stay with you after the dust settles?

We are now working in collaboration with artists and the Israeli Post Office on the production of a limited edition of unique stamps, specially designed for Midburn 2015.

This is the kind of stamp you'd want to accompany the letter you send home. The ultimate souvenir that every Midburner wants to stick in their stamp collection or leave as an inheritance to their grandchildren. To maintain the prestige - this stamp edition will be printed in only 2015 copies. Anyone holding it will literally be holding a piece of history!

6,000 citizens will be visiting the city this year and only 1/3 of them will get their grubby paws on these rare stamps – so why not secure your very own stamp in advance!?!

You got this far and still don't know what Midburn is?

During May 20-24, 2015 - 6,000 people will be creating a temporary city in the Negev desert, filling it with content, art, music and sensational enthusiasm. Theme camps are the heart of the city.

As part of these 6,000 residents, we are excited to create the theme camp: –"Post Trauma Post Office".

The first ever post office of Midburn is inviting you to support us in fulfilling our vision!

Cut the bull - how can you help?

Building an active post office, designed and packed with content, bureaucratic materials you won't  want to dispose of, and a whole lot of other unforgettable surprises, producing the first edition of Midburn stamps in thousands of copies, printing thousands of uniquely designed postcards - all of these things cost quite a bit. Well, actually quite a lot.

You, on the other hand, can put in a small contribution and help us give the city a great perk.

Your contribution will be used for the design and construction of the post office decor, designing and printing of stamps, postcards, additional bureaucratic materials and other surprises which we could tell you about, but won't, cause we don't want to ruin the surprise, do we?!

The minimum contribution is only NIS 10, so anyone can take part!

The perks are great and you're more than welcome to pick them up at our post office.

Not coming to Midburn this year? You can support the post office and production of the Midburn stamp even if you can't make it to Midburn this year and allow us to give the gift of a special souvenir (or a traumatic experience) to the city's residents.

Loved the idea but aren't able to support it? No worries! You can share this project and invite your friends to support.

And don't forget to come visit us at the Post Trauma Post Office!
story_txt:
Support the first ever Midburn Post Trauma Post Office!

?הגעתם עד כאן ואתם לא יודעים מה זה מידברן 
בין ה- 20-24/5 צפויים כ- 6000 אנשים להפוך לתושבים בעיר מדבר זמנית – למלא אותה בתוכן, באמנות, במוסיקה ובטירוף חושים מוחלט. מחנות נושא הם לב ליבה של העיר.  
אנחנו חלק מ- 6,000 התושבים, נרגשים ליצור את מחנה דואר – פוסט טראומה: 
סניף הדואר הראשון באירוע מידברן 2015 ומזמינים אתכם לתמוך במימוש הרעיון שלנו!
?קאט דה בול: איך אתם יכולים לעזור 
יצירת סניף דואר פעיל, מעוצב ומלא בתוכן, בחומרים בירוקרטיים שלא תרצו להשליך, והפתעות שלא תשכחו, הפקת מהדורת הבולים הראשונה באלפי עותקים, הדפסה של אלפי גלויות מעוצבות וייחודיות – כל אלה עולים לא מעט. לא מעט בכלל. 
אתם, לעומת זאת, יכולים לתמוך מעט ולעזור לנו להעניק לעיר מתנה גדולה. 
התמיכה שלכם תשמש לעיצוב ובניית התפאורה של סניף הדואר, לעיצוב והדפסת הבולים, הגלויות, החומרים הביורוקרטיים הנוספים ולעוד הפתעות שהיינו מגלים לכם, אבל זו לא תהיה הפתעה. 
סכום התמיכה המינימלי עומד על 5 דולר בלבד, כך שכל אחד ואחת מכם יכולים לקחת חלק!
בסוף הארוע נפרסם דו"ח שקיפות על השימוש בכספים
התשורות כולן נהדרות ואתם מוזמנים לאסוף אותן אצלנו במחנה הדואר

 


לא מגיעים השנה למידברן? תוכלו כמובן לתמוך בהקמת סניף הדואר והפקת בול מידברן גם אם לא תגיעו השנה למידברן - ולאפשר לנו להעניק מזכרת (או חוויה טראומטית) לתושבי העיר. 
עפתם מהרעיון אבל לא יכולים לתמוך? לא נורא! תוכלו לשתף את הפרויקט ולהזמין חברים לתמוך. 
ואל תשכחו לבוא לבקר אותנו בסניף הדואר! 


Support the first ever
Midburn Post
Trauma Post Office!
We're not just a bunch of
guys with horns - we have a vision!
In May 2015, for 5 days and nights, we'll
establish a real life, formal, desert post office which will take the temporary
city residents on a colorful and crazy journey into the depths of bureaucracy!
At Midburn's Post Trauma Post Office you'll be
able to send letters, postcards and souvenirs from the Playa - indeed, real
letters which will arrive safely anywhere you want outside or inside the Playa!

You'll be able to receive a love letter from
yourself, send singing telegrams, get surprising packages from people you've
never met, pay fines for crimes you didn't commit and get all the information
you never needed to know. And that's not all.
The Post Trauma Post Office will leave its mark
on you. We promise.
So who are we?
For the occasion of the establishment of the
first post office in Midburn 2015, we have come together, women and men, who
know a thing or two about bureaucracy, designing postcards and stamps, words,
letters, poems, and some other stuff - and have established the theme camp: Post
Trauma Post Office .
We are the post-men and women who will forever
change anything and everything you thought about snail mail. And Araq.
Wouldn't you just love to
have a stamp of proof that you were actually at Midburn? A souvenir that'll stay with
you after the dust settles?
We are now working in collaboration with artists
and the Israeli Post Office on the production of a limited edition of unique
stamps, specially designed for Midburn 2015.
This is the kind of stamp you'd want to accompany
the letter you send home. The ultimate souvenir that every Midburner wants to
stick in their stamp collection or leave as an inheritance to their
grandchildren. To maintain the prestige - this stamp edition will be printed
in only 2015 copies. Anyone holding it will literally be holding a piece of
history!



6,000 citizens will be
visiting the city this year and only 1/3 of them will get their grubby paws on these
rare stamps – so why not secure your very own stamp in advance!?!
You got this far and still
don't know what Midburn is?
During May 20-24, 2015 - 6,000 people will be
creating a temporary city in the Negev desert, filling it with content, art,
music and sensational enthusiasm. Theme camps are the heart of the city.
As part of these 6,000 residents, we are excited
to create the theme camp: –"Post Trauma Post Office".
The first ever post office of Midburn is
inviting you to support us in fulfilling our vision!
Cut the bull - how can you
help?
Building an active post office, designed and
packed with content, bureaucratic materials you won't  want to dispose of, and a whole lot of other
unforgettable surprises, producing the first edition of Midburn stamps in
thousands of copies, printing thousands of uniquely designed postcards - all of
these things cost quite a bit. Well, actually quite a lot.
You, on the other hand, can
put in a small contribution and help us give the city a great perk.
Your contribution will be used for the design
and construction of the post office decor, designing and printing of stamps,
postcards, additional bureaucratic materials and other surprises which we could
tell you about, but won't, cause we don't want to ruin the surprise, do we?!
The minimum contribution is
only NIS 10, so anyone can take part!
The perks are great and you're more than
welcome to pick them up at our post office.
Not coming to Midburn this
year?
You can support the post office and production of the Midburn stamp even if you
can't make it to Midburn this year and allow us to give the gift of a special
souvenir (or a traumatic experience) to the city's residents.
Loved the idea but aren't
able to support it? No worries! You can share this project and invite your friends to
support.
And don't forget to come visit us at the Post
Trauma Post Office!

story:
Julia Veenstra Studios Presents:

www.juliaveenstra.com

I have so much fun paintings cows! One painting was chosen to be the poster girl for the Canadian Royal Winter Fair. 


I am an artist from Hamilton, Ontario. I work in bold, colourful acrylics. The bony shapes and moody expressions of cows always get my brush loose. The cows seem to have stories to tell, and this book will tell the stories. I recently became a grandmother and I am inspired to create a children's book!


The Book

This will be a hardcover book featuring 26 vibrant images and a fun alphabet story. The book is illustrated with paintings of cows from my collection, accompanied by an ABC story written by my daughter, an Art and English teacher and new mum. The story is in a final draft, but will be tweaked to feature some of YOU! (see the perks section). The finished hardcover book will retail for $25. 

The Campaign

The funds from this campaign will go towards the publishing of 1000 copies of a high quality, full colour, hard cover book. Those costs include hiring a professional design and layout, as well as the cost of printing. My daughter and I are working closely with a book designer, and the project needs a financial investment to take it to the next step. 

This is your chance to be a part of the story. You can support its publication by pre-ordering the book, or having your name or your child's name featured in the story!


Check out the great perks! All will be available before Christmas!

story:
We are the Tulsa Art Deco Museum located in the heart of the Deco District in Downtown Tulsa, Oklahoma. The purpose of our museum is to heighten awareness and appreciation of Art Deco Design from around the world, throughout history, and with particular emphasis on Tulsa’s unique Art Deco history.  We also seek to preserve, promote and expand upon the Art Deco treasures that Tulsa already possesses by collecting and displaying art pieces from around the world.

Equally important are our goals to explore the amazing historic, cultural, and scientific contexts present during the birth of this bold design style.  There were many fascinating cultural changes and scientific discoveries during the 1920s and 30s that influenced the art of that era.  We will also continue our efforts to educate the general public, children, tourists and other special interest groups about Art Deco and its connection to today’s modern art. 

In order to accomplish our goals we need your help! By donating to our cause you will help supply us with lights and cleaning supplies in order to properly preserve, protect, and present our Art Deco artifacts and history to the public. 

The Tulsa Art Deco Museum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

story:
AFC's Fall Fundraiser for Independence: Join the Resistance

THE YEAR: 2015. Museum funding is dominated by oil companies and predatory sitcom stars. Commercial galleries are overrun by unwashed hordes of celebrity-driven exhibitions, and universities are giving out honorary doctorates to these same people. Rampant gentrification has caused artist-run galleries to Escape From New York. Art publications are gobbling each other up into monopolies like zombies hungry for brains. Press releases for retrospectives include statements like “Inspiration and innovation equally power Volkswagen Group of America on the road toward the future.”

But on the road toward this dystopian future, there is hope. Fiercely independent, relentlessly critical, and tirelessly fighting for truth and justice: the warriors of Art F City have pledged to defend artists and their audiences from the decline of civilization. But we need your help. We need to pay our writers and take Art F City to the next level. In the barren wastelands of arts funding, only the strong survive.

Video by Jen Catron and Paul Outlaw

About 

Art F City creates and archives critical discourse, and commissions ambitious artist projects. Through a daily mix of blunt criticism, commentary and community-minded journalism, we add an unparalleled dosage of purposeful opinion to the contemporary art community.

Art is without a public purpose if it is not tested and understood. To this end, Art F City provides a moderated public forum across comment threads, artist essays, and roundtable criticism. Our nine-year archives provide an extensive historical record of that discourse. By encouraging a critical and informed audience, our public initiatives fill a critical need for all creative makers.

Art must be interrogated.

What We Need

$20,000 is the minimum we need to pay our writers and continue our public programming. Art F City is one of the few remaining independent voices in art media: The blog consistently produce smart, accessible reviews and news and work tirelessly to expose the work of new emerging artist. Without their voice, publishing will consist only of large media corps, with the smaller, more personality driven voices all but gone. 

And their programming extends far beyond the blog. 

It includes:
  • Stay in New York, The Affordable Workspace Conference at The Queens Museum
  • Studio in Crisis, a symposium at Cabinet about rising real estate prices in New York.
  • IMG MGMT, our acclaimed image-based artist essay series

Testimonials

“An ambitious option [to mainstream print criticism] that combines criticism, reporting, political activism and gossip on an almost ­24­hour news cycle. That mix would probably be even more varied, and transcultural, if a few forward­thinking, art­minded investors would infuse some serious capital into such enterprises so they could pay writers a living wage.”—Holland Cotter, Lost in the Gallery Industrial Complex, the New York Times, January 17, 2014

“Art F City consistently publishes smart, socially conscious articles. They are an essential independent voice.” Deborah Kass, artist

"Are you the kind of art person who laments that New York has become dull and consensus-driven, that it doesn't pay enough attention to the weird or the unheard or the over-looked? Here's something simple you can actually do: Support a website that is purpose-built to cover all those things. Paddy Johnson is relentless"." Ben Davis, national critic, Artnet news.

"The Best New York Art Blog" — Village Voice, Village Voice Web Awards, 2010, 2011

    What You Get

    Helping us reach our campaign goal ensures that you are able to read the clear, no bullshit style that is the hallmark of Art F City. It keeps the blogs coming. 

    In addition to ongoing programming, those who donate to the AFC Fall Fundraiser will get some very special perks. Donate and you can receive:


    Picturing the Past Ten Years by Phillip Niemeyer. Give at the $125 level.


    No Donation too Small

    In these parts, even five dollars goes a long way. There's no support you can offer that's too small.

    Spread the Word

    The resistance is in constant need of new recruits. Spread the word! Share it on social media: Facebook, Twitter and Instagram! Email your friends!

    Committee

    Deborah Brown, Saul Chernick, Robert Dimin , Michael Farley, Carla Gannis, Paddy Johnson, Elissa Levy, Glenn Macura, Jereme Mongeon , Danielle Mysliwiec, Rea McNamara, Marsha Owett, Andréa Salerno, Alex Teplitsky, Jeffrey Teuton, John Tomlinson and Helena Willner.

    First Donors

    Bad at Sports, Natalie Bell, Gretchen Frances Bennett, Saul Chernick, Patrick Farley, Jessica Goehring, Joseph Gurka, Michael Hafftka, Corinna Kirsch, Melanie Kress, Vincent Lafrance, Carol Levin, Justin Macuga, Ann McRae, Virginie Michelet, Lorna Mills, Jereme Mongeon, Danielle Mysliwiec, Shasti O'Leary, Joelle Te Paske, Chandra Eve Siegel and Manon Slome. Thank you for critical support of our pre-campaign efforts!

story:
UPDATE 8/19/15 - FINAL 24 HOURS to donate! EVERY DOLLAR donated during these last 24 hours will be DOUBLED (we have a matching donor). UPDATED Stretch Goal $8,500

UPDATE 8/16/15 - Great News! Art for Trees found a generous donor that will double our contributions by matching what we raise NOW! So your $20 donation is actually $40, your $50 will become $100, and so on. If we bring in another $5,000 in these next 3 DAYS we will in fact raise a total of $10,000 – that means $5,000 to help build the Temple of Promise and $5,000 towards planting trees!

Great News #2: Attention Jewelry of Burning Man lovers - donate $250 or higher and you will be sent this limited edition Temple 2015 Medallion (see photo below). Intricately hand-crafted by master jeweler Tzipora Hoynik out of hand-poured metal with a wooden inlaid, bas-relief laser carved Tree by Keelan made from wood used to build the Temple.  This 2 inch in diameter, 1.7 ounce collectible is signed and numbered. Only 100 were made in the first run and they are all gone but the artist is making an additional 25 for Art for Trees (and right now there are only 10 left). LAST CHANCE – to own this treasure so please respond soon by making a donation – or increasing the donation you already made - before midnight Wednesday August 19th (fulfillment will be after Burning Man due to the timing).


Art for Trees – Burning Man 2015:  It’s year three for Art for Trees! Through our collective efforts with fundraising for Temple for Trees (2013) and Art for Trees (2014), our community has rallied to plant over 5,100 seedling trees to replenish a portion of the wood we burned at Burning Man over the past two years.

The Temple at Burning Man 2015, The Temple of Promise:  Poetically, this year the final destination of the Temple 2015 is an homage to the healing power of TREES: “The curving space tapers to a final archway of 10 by 7 feet, elegantly opening into the contemplative altar and the heart of this Temple: a grove of three sculpted TREES with overlapping canopies that reach around 15 feet high. The branches are initially bare and participants can write messages on long strips of cloth and attach them to each tree, creating the gentle shade of Weeping Willows with each day.”

Over the years, there has been a reoccurring theme of tree-inspired art at Burning Man including this year's Honorariums The Temple of Promise, Arbour, Bone Tree, The Infinity Tree, Kinetic Forest and in previous years the Mangrove, Futures Past,  Steampunk Tree House, HELIX – not to mention the plethora of art built from trees – that demonstrate our deep connection to timber. Art for Trees builds upon Burning Man’s 2007 Green Man theme, which expressed artists’ desires to recognize “the immanence of nature in our lives.”

This year’s Temple Builders, The Dreamers Guild, have committed to help replace the wood that the Temple of Promise will burn.  We asked tree experts for assistance with calculations on the number of replacement trees by converting the weight of construction lumber into board feet of lumber. A board foot is a standard measure of the usable wood in a tree. You can picture a board foot as a piece of lumber one-inch thick, one foot wide, and one foot long (1" x 12" x 12"). With adjustments for mortality, age at harvest, growing site quality and other variables (water, disease, insects, competition for sunlight, etc.), in 2013 we calculated that we needed to re-plant about 1,000 seedlings to replenish the Temple wood.  We have used this calculation as a baseline for each year.  So this year’s Art for Tree’s overall $7,000 fundraising goal is two-fold: 1. gift funds towards construction costs to help build the Temple of Promise as well as; 2. raise funds to help plant trees to replenish the wood that the Temple consumes. Both objectives are symbiotic and serve our community to the fullest. If we raise more than $7,000, of course we can donate even more towards construction costs for the Temple of Promise as well as replant additional trees to replenish the wood consumed from all the artwork that will be engulfed in flames at Burning Man.

Leaving a POSITIVE Trace:  By replacing renewable resources that we consciously consume, we are expanding our cultural ethos and leaving a tangible legacy.

At this point, The 10 Principles of Burning Man are hard-coded into our community’s collective consciousness – especially the concept of Leaving NO Trace – as in detritus pre/during/post event and limiting our overall carbon footprint getting to and from Black Rock City. But the Yin to that Yang would be to literally and figuratively germinate resources and ideas from our participation. This forward-looking intention – simply replanting trees after they are consumed – helps resolve conflicts about igniting treasured resources by honoring the regeneration cycle mirrored in nature. Combined, our uncomplicated efforts to plant seedlings year over year will leave a positive legacy as our newly planted Burning Man Tree Groves in Appalachia and the Stanislaus National Forest demonstrate.

Art for Trees Mission Statement:  The Art for Trees project is a tribute to Trees and develops awareness-based initiatives in order safeguard their plenitude. We want to insure that future Burning Man artists will have access to wood simply by replenishing what we use. Wood is an essential building material and integral to most playa-based art projects - from framing canvases for paintings to building camps and shade to the underlying architecture of many large scale installations. Whether art burns or not is almost irrelevant since harvested wood is still consumed on many levels to support our composite visions. Lumber is a natural resource that is renewable and our community’s Leave No Trace ethos logically expands to support measures to protect our planet’s gifts.

Film and original music:  The amazing Roy Two Thousand

http://roy2k.com/
http://vimeo.com/roytwothousand

Original watercolor art and animation: Crystal Dawn Davis http://dreaminginwatercolor.com/

https://www.facebook.com/DreamingInWatercolor

Thank you for your consideration, for helping spread the word on our mission, and for loving TREES!

calculations on the number of replacement trees by converting the weight of construction
lumber into board feet of lumber. A board foot is a standard measure of the
usable wood in a tree. You can picture a board foot as a piece of lumber
one-inch thick, one foot wide, and one foot long (1" x 12" x
12"). With adjustments for mortality, age at harvest, growing site quality and other
variables  (water, disease, insects,
competition for sunlight, etc.), in 2013 we calculated that we needed to re-plant about 1,000 seedlings to replenish the Temple wood.  We have used this calculation as a baseline for each year.  So
this year’s Art for Tree’s overall $7,000 fundraising goal is two-fold: 1. gift
funds towards construction costs to help build the Temple of Promise as well as; 2. raise
funds to help plant trees to replenish the wood that the Temple consumes. Both
objectives are symbiotic and serve our community to the fullest. If
we raise more than $7,000, of course we can donate even more towards construction
costs for the Temple of Promise as well as replant additional trees to replenish the
wood consumed from all the artwork that will be engulfed in flames at Burning Man.
Leaving a POSITIVE Trace:  By replacing renewable resources that we
consciously consume, we are
expanding our cultural ethos and leaving a tangible legacy.

At this point, The 10 Principles of Burning Man are hard-coded into
our community’s collective consciousness – especially the concept of Leaving NO
Trace – as in detritus pre/during/post event and limiting our overall carbon
footprint getting to and from Black Rock City. But the Yin to that Yang would be to literally
and figuratively germinate resources and ideas from our participation. This forward-looking
intention – simply replanting trees after they are consumed –  helps resolve
conflicts about igniting treasured resources by honoring the regeneration cycle
mirrored in nature. Combined, our uncomplicated efforts to plant seedlings year
over year will leave a positive legacy as our newly planted Burning Man Tree Groves in
Appalachia and the Stanislaus National Forest demonstrate.
Art for Trees Mission Statement:  The Art for Trees project is a
tribute to Trees and develops awareness-based initiatives in order safeguard
their plenitude. We want to insure that future Burning Man artists will have
access to wood simply by replenishing what we use. Wood is an essential
building material and integral to most playa-based art projects - from framing
canvases for paintings to building camps and shade to the underlying
architecture of many large scale installations. Whether art burns or not is
almost irrelevant since harvested wood is still consumed on many levels to
support our composite visions. Lumber is a natural resource that is renewable
and our community’s Leave No Trace ethos logically expands to support measures
to protect our planet’s gifts.
Film and original music:  The amazing Roy Two Thousandhttp://roy2k.com/
http://vimeo.com/roytwothousand
Original watercolor art and animation: Crystal Dawn Davis http://dreaminginwatercolor.com/https://www.facebook.com/DreamingInWatercolorThank you for your consideration, for helping spread the word on our mission, and for loving TREES!

story:
I need help to publish my book.  I've been working on the illustrations for nearly two years, and I have been painting for 50 years,and I've come up with a clever idea, that I think will be very popular.

 It is a collection of visual puns that is entertaining, as well as educational, and hopefully designed to give the reader a different understanding of the English language.  It has been reviewed by people of all ages and professions with positive reactions.  

 My publication cost is approximately $2500. 

I think the book will be fun for all ages, and would be a great teaching tool, in "English as a Second Language" Course.

"What You Get" for your contribution

All Contributors will receive a Shout Out, & Thank you! on My social Media Page.

Five dollar contributors will get a Thank You, on Social Media.

Ten dollar contributors will get you ONE copy of the book, if you agree to pay shipping.

Twenty dollars will get you ONE copy of the book, postage paid.

Thirty dollars will get you TWO "signed"copies of the book, postage paid.

Fifty dollars will get you, THREE "signed" copies of the book, postage paid.

One Hundred dollar contributors will get two "signed" copies, and 2 

8" x 10" prints, from the book, suitable for framing. all postage paid.

story:
The Artist and the Opportunity

My name is Amanda Brown. I am a working artist living in Chicago. After a break from my painting practice since graduating from the School of Art institute of Chicago, I have returned to the brush, palette and canvas. Over the last year I worked hard, making regular time in my studio and investing faith in my own eyes and hands, to rebuild a relationship with my work. In support of my continuing practice, I applied and was accepted into Foundation Obras in Portugal.

Foundation Obras is an artist residency located in the countryside of Portugal, between Estremoz and Evora. By providing affordable room and board, Obras creates an opportunity for artists to have uninterrupted time to explore an idea or establish a body of work. Surrounded by the natural landscape of the country, the residency grounds offers a visually inspiring environment all the more conducive to creativity.

For the month of August, I will utilize my stay to create a series of paintings that depend on the direct interaction of the local landscape. Produced in an en plein air approach,  these paintings will provide a necessary foundation for, not only future work in the studio, but also my maturity as a painter.

Help me get there!

Although Obras has made my stay in Portugal extremely affordable, I still need some help getting there! Your donations will help me offset all expenses relating to travel! Airfare to get me to Portugal and bus/taxi/train fare for while I am there.

My Gratitude

Your contributions to my residency will help fund an unforgettable experience that will give to my growth as an artist in ways that will far surpass its monetary value. As a small gift of gratitude, to all who donate for various amounts I will send a postcard from Portugal!

See My Work!

Make sense to see the work of the artist you're supporting! You can see my past and current work HERE!

story:
Proyecto Valioso 

Durante dos años investigué con testigos vivientes de la época que narro, simultaneando con la investigación de 15 años en la prensa cubana de la época de la década del 1950, aún sin digitalizar. No se habían descrito los detalles de las vivencias de Daniel Santos en La Habana, después de una búsqueda similar de 1946 a 1961.

El periodismo de investigación es mi pasión, al igual que el trabajo documental para la televisión donde trabajé por años. De ahí llegué primero a la figura de Alberto Granado, aquel joven que acompañó al Che Guevara en motocicleta por Latinoamérica. La historia que los enlaza de nuevo en la vida y más allá, se narra en el primer libro que escribí en 2009: “El Ché confía en mí”, para éste, ahora busco una editorial. De manera simultánea, realizo un guion de cine -basado en mi libro “Daniel Santos: La Habana que hay en mí”- para realizar la película del Inquieto Anacobero en La Habana, para la cual los productores buscan financiamiento. Así es el mundo de los creadores independientes. Una vez esté, se podrá rodar en los escenarios reales.

Retos y Desafios:

El mayor desafío es hacer las cosas por amor, en tiempos de tanto egoísmo. Me inspira dejar constancia escrita de esa época que mis padres disfrutaron, y que si no legamos la memoria a nuestros hijos, se perderá. Yo me crie con las canciones de Daniel Santos, tarareadas por mi abuela y soy hija de la generación de los “50”. De esa estirpe de altruistas enamorados. Vamos adelante con la convicción de que los recursos aparecen, antes o después, cuando hay valor histórico, documental y musical en el contenido propuesto. Las editoriales no pagan pasajes, ni presentaciones en librerías, ni en las ferias de libros, donde una puede dar a conocer las obras a los Medios de Difusión y a sus destinatarios, los lectores. Tampoco pagan la impresión de obras, a menos que una sea super conocida, es el cuento del huevo y la gallina. Pues, hagámoslo nosotros.

 

Porque viajar a Bogotá, Colombia?

Imagino bien cuando pienso que Colombia puede hacer con mi libro, lo que hizo Cuba por Daniel Santos, internacionalizarlo. Y lo digo porque no conozco otro lugar donde amen y veneren más a Daniel Santos con tal pasión. Al parecer fue mutuo, sino miren esto:


Para llegar a las presentaciones en Bogotá, a la Feria del Libro (FILBO), a los lectores de Cali, Medellín, necesito una pequeña contribución económica de cada persona. A quien le sea posible y si no, por favor compartan este deseo, porque sus ganas también cuentan para mí. Si usted está cerca y consigue llegar a la presentación, vaya a abrazarme, compartiremos la alegría. Sino escríbame a la página de Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dsantoshabana/?fref=ts
Esto no se queda aquí, después haremos la película, y sonreiremos juntos, desde la butaca, con el libro o en el cine.
¡Gracias por su ayuda, de corazón!

Llegó Daniel Santos.
Él estuvo entrando y saliendo por quince años de la “Cubita de sus amores”. “Gozando y jodiendo”, dicho por él a esta que está aquí. Yo creo mucho en el destino, y no fue por gusto que vino a dar acá, de cuantos lugares había para triunfar en la vida. (Fragmento de la obra).

Sinopsis del Libro: 

(Que podrán tener) 

Daniel Santos se alista para llegar a La Habana, después de 30 años de ausencia. En esta ciudad, donde sus amores y bendiciones musicales, colmaron la vida del artista puertorriqueño durante 15 años –un poco antes y después- de la década de 1950, los cubanos lo mantienen latiendo en sus corazones. Enterados de su llegada, sonando aún en los viejos tocadiscos caseros y en la radio nacional, le preparan un extraordinario homenaje. Una mujer que lo amó, levanta su copa en el Bar San Juan, con el hondo recuento de su vida, de la cual guarda insospechadas huellas. El día señalado llega con la noticia de su muerte. La narración literaria, basada en una investigación periodística documental, también recrea la vida de la Habana, Cuba, a través de Daniel Santos. La historia, asentada en hechos reales, proviene de una profunda exploración en la prensa de la época, aun sin digitalizar y con el color de la añoranza. Entrevistas con quienes compartieron el escenario y la vida, avalaron las vivencias junto a quien bien ganó el epíteto de: “Inquieto Anacobero en La Habana”. Daniel Santos, artista popular boricua, tan querido como controversial, celebra en 2016, el año de su Centenario.

story:
Short Summary

  The Warwick Summer Arts Festival (WSAF) takes its 16th year celebration to the streets with a carnival style celebration of the arts. Aligning with the elements of the iconic public street celebration known as carnivals or fairs, WSAF is scheduled to run from July 15-23.

What We Need

 Our goal of $4000 will help us:
-pay performers
-pay stage crew
-build stages
-provide artist materials
 

The Impact

 The WSAF wild bring attention to the arts with public celebrations reminiscent of a traveling carnival. Throughout the nine day festival, musicians and dancers will perform in unassuming venues such as local farms and fields; artwork, spanning a combination of mediums, will be exhibited at local businesses. WSAF will collaborate with many local businesses and organizations. Many of these collaborators will assist by offering space, presenting the farmland and parks for musical, dance and literary performances throughout the festival. 

Risks & Challenges

Due to the nature of our mostly outdoor community festival, we have come to expect the unexpected. Each festival brings on new unforeseeable challenges.

Past challenges have included:

-relocation due to inclement weather

-electrical & technical outages

-staff shortage

-budget constraints

.. and our personal favorite, the bat that got trapped in the theater during tech rehearsal.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

 -Spread the word on social media! Share our posts on Facebook & Instagram.
-Good old word of mouth! Talk us up!
-Attend our events and bring friends.

story:
What We Are Doing:

Seven Texas photographers are collaborating on a group exhibition of photographs made with film cameras and printed in the darkroom.  The photographers are established artists who choose to work with film and the darkroom for all or much of their work.

Our purpose is to highlight the richness and diversity of images created using film and darkroom processes, in the hopes of building a community of film photographers in the North Texas area.  We know through informal associations, internet and social media groups, etc., that there are hundreds of photographers in the area that use film on a regular basis.  Eventually, we hope to have an active, established group that will be able to produce two exhibitions annually, such as an open membership show and a selective, juried show.

We expect that once a group is established, future exhibitions will be self-financing.  However, in the meantime, we need to be successful with this first exhibition, to show that it can be done, and this is where you can help.

What We Need & What You Get

Each of the photographers in this show will, of course, finance the creation of their own work.  However, there are production expenses in mounting any exhibition that are unavoidable.  Quality exhibition venues are generally not free and often galleries look for a prior history of success in order to allocate space to an artist or a group.

After many months of work, we secured consideration for the gallery expense for this exhibition and some funding is pledged for reception expenses.  However, there are other unavoidable expenses that remain, and these include hardware and tools for hanging the photographs, printing expenses for signage at the gallery, and other miscellaneous costs.

Even so, our needs are modest.  We have a production budget of $500.  If we raise more than is needed at this time, excess funds will be applied to future exhibitions.

There will be a prominent sign at the gallery listing our contributors (you may remain anonymous, if desired).  In addition, we will list all contributors on social media and the Silver Darkroom website and blog.

We are offering a number of used photography and darkroom items as "perks" for various contributions.  There are also some books and original prints available.  Please see the Gallery section for details on the perks.  All contributions for which you will receive a perk include shipping.  However, if you wish to add a little more to your contribution to cover shipping, that would be appreciated.  If you do claim a perk, please email and let us know which one, so it can be set aside for you. Thanks!

You can be a patron of the arts and film photography by supporting this exhibition.

Risks & Challenges

Support of film photography is necessary if the medium is to continue to be healthy.

The chances of success for this endeavor are very good.  All seven photographers are committed and the work is prepared for exhibition.  The gallery is contracted for the dates.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition (or in place of) a financial contribution, you can also help in other ways:

  • Please help get the word out about this campaign and the exhibition.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  Please share this campaign on all of your social media and internet communities.
  • Tell your friends.
  • Come see the exhibit!  You are especially invited to the reception on October 19th.

Details of the Exhibition

Prints shown will include silver gelatin, as well as other “alternative” processes. 

The exhibition will feature the work of seven photographers:

  • David Brown
  • Valerie Yaklin-Brown
  • Michael Castles
  • J. B. Harlin 
  • Susan Harlin
  • Matthew Magruder
  • William McEwen

October 3 - 23, 2014

Janette Kennedy Gallery
Southside on Lamar
1409 South Lamar St.
Dallas TX, 75215

Artists’ reception: Sunday, October 19th, 1:00 - 4:00.

For additional information, or if you have questions, please email us at 

email:  silverdarkroom@yahoo.com

web:  www.silverdarkroom.net

blog:  http://silverdarkroom.wordpress.com

story:
Filling a Niche in Savannah's Creative Community

Over the past several years the creative community in Savannah has grown in leaps and bounds.  With organizations like ArtRise and the Creative Coast lending their expertise and encouragement, many local creative businesses have started and thrived, especially in the area South of Forsyth Park.  There is one niche that has not been filled however: inexpensive artist workspaces comprised of a community of makers.  That is the role Sulfur Studios aims to fill.  Our vision is to create a vibrant and supportive environment for Savannah’s creative community, which will help encourage talented and energetic individuals to settle in our beautiful city.


We Need Your Help to Make it Happen

We have a great opportunity to make a collaborative and supportive art space in the  Starland/SoFo neighborhood that will meet the needs of Savannah’s creative community.  The proposed space is a nearly 5,000sqft building located just a few blocks from many other local, creative businesses, such as Graveface Records, Back in the Day Bakery, Gypsy Girl Vintage, Fresh Exhibitions, Obscura Photoworks,  Urban Poppy and many more.  


Sulfur Studios will feature 14 affordable artist's studios, a large gallery, and a communal storage and project space.  It will also provide the venue for community events, such as workshops and classes, lectures, and group critiques. Located directly on the ArtMarch route, Sulfur Studios will host monthly open studios and receptions in which the public will be invited in to see our members' creative work in action.

The layout of the Space

We are looking to raise $8,000 in order to secure the building and make some necessary upgrades to the space, which includes updating the electrical, putting in new flooring, painting, and installing a professional gallery lighting and hanging system.  

The Gallery Pre-Renovation

We plan to start moving artists into the studios in early January, with improvements to the space continuing through the end of February.  The gallery will host its first exhibition in March of 2015.

The 8' x 8' Studio Spaces

We have some great perks to share with our donors, including Sulfur Studio gear like T-shirts and Tote Bags featuring our logo, designed by local artist Ugis Berzins, and awesome prints and original work from some of our artist partners.  

$10 Contribution Level: Stickers!

$25 Contribution Level: Postcards from Emily Earl

$500 Contributions Level: Original Art By Jennifer Moss


Sulfur Studios: About the Name

Sulfur is the 16th element of the Periodic Table. It is composed of 16 protons, bound together to create the nucleus of the atom.  Sulfur Studios provides a total of 16 spaces, each used by individuals for their own creative purposes within the larger whole of the collective.

Sulfur also has symbolic connections to the human soul and creativity in medieval alchemy, and is an important component of life on our planet.  Any Savannah native will recognize the pervasive nature of sulfur when the wind is right; we want to replace this with new, more positive associations.


Risks & Challenges

This is a big project with a huge impact for Savannah.  We are currently in the process of obtaining permits and licenses and do not foresee an issue, but we still have several hoops to jump through with the City of Savannah.  It's also a large building with equally large expenses, so if we do not reach our funding goal we may not be able to secure it for our purposes. BUT...

We strongly believe that Savannah needs a collaborative artist workspace like Sulfur Studios, and we are committed to making it happen.  If we do not raise the full funds or run into problems with the proposed building we have several smaller fallback possibilities, so no matter what, all funds donated will go towards creating a supportive work environment for artists in Savannah.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate please consider sharing our campaign with your friends and family.

We can also use donations of furniture and equipment, contact us if you have something cluttering up your home or studio that you'd like to see go to a good cause. Specific needs include: Comfortable furniture for our lounge, a refrigerator for the kitchenette, and office furniture, especially a desk and filing cabinet.

If you are in the Savannah area, come check out the space and see how you can get involved! Contact us at sulfurstudios@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Tulie Mitiuriev (aka- MsMagicAnimations on YouTube), and I am an aspiring 3D artist and 2D character artist. I specialize in 3D and 2D artwork, with the ultimate goal being that I create story driven content for games and animation. On my YouTube channel, I am known to provide tutorials for Blender when dealing with 3D artwork, and Krita when dealing with 2D artwork.
  • This campaign's goal is to fund for repairs on the computer that enabled me to create artwork. Like any artist, tools are needed to project my creations, and such creations are built through the electronic canvases within my computer.
  • With sufficient funding, contributors will not only help help fund an artist's livelihood; they will help fund for a future in allowing the artist to breathe life into 2D and 3D characters, and thus fund for her future in animation. 

What We Need

  • $550 are needed to repair the computer. The cost covers the fees in labor repair, transportation, and needed new parts for assemblage.

The Impact

  • The project is valuable in allowing an artist reach their goal to become an employee for the vast realm of the entertainment industry, in which such a realm opens the possibilities of working within the animation industry and/or gaming industry.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can, tell others about this campaign!
  • When sharing this campaign with other, please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Hi my name is Bogdana, a freelance makeup artist and hairstyler, and I am thanking you in advance for taking the time to read my story. It was difficult to write as asking for help is not something that I was comfortable doing, but yet this is where I am at “I need help”.
        I am a wife to my husband and a mother of twin three year olds and we all live in beautiful Calgary, Alberta of Canada. I have a career that I love and am passionate about and worked really hard to build. We originally came from Romania and have moved to Canada. I graduated in Europe, Romania from En Vogue Aesthetic Studio as make up artistry, and so when I moved to Calgary it was many hours of working for free or little to build contacts, networks, and a client base for my business to create earnings.
            On June 20th, I was settling the boys in for their afternoon nap when the fire alarm went off. I packed them downstairs in their pajamas to find out what was happening. I saw many with suitcases and yet I still didn’t understand what was happening. When they told us that we needed to evacuate the apartment building, I told them that I was going to get my vehicle, which was underground parked to which they responded that it was already submersed in water. My heart sank, as all of my business was in the car’s trunk, my artistry kit, hair tools, my hours of work, my savings to build up the kit, and my income. It was all in there. I know that we are safe and I am thankful of that, and yet I am worried for how I am going to start again. I finally got to the place in my career that I need to be, and now my supplies and tools are lost.
            We do not know when we are going to be allowed to return to the apartment to rebuild, and have found out that the insurance will help us with our vehicle but not the chairs, and they are already trying to give us hard time. Also they are not covering my business supplies, which is estimated at $4500 and up. I have jobs coming up, and really want to be there for the people that depend on me.

            Here in Calgary, we are trying to help each other how we can now after the flood disaster.  If we all come together, any contribution will help, $1, $5 , $20, or whatever you have on your heart so I can rebuild what I lost in terms of business supplies, artistry kit, my job. Or simply share my story to others would mean a lot to me.

            You can find out more of my work, passion and the person beneath the makeup by visiting my Facebook page below. Also you can check the gallery for details about damages and flood. Help me start again.

 

      Thank you for taking the time to read, just hearing my story means a lot to me.

Bogdana Miron

 

“Beneath the makeup and behind the smile I am just a girl who wishes for the world.”
― MarilynMonroe

 

For additional questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at : artistrybybobi@yahoo.com

 

https://www.facebook.com/ArtistryByBobi?fref=ts

story:
Reel Salinas Public Art!

Trompe l'oeil Public Art in Downtown Salinas!

  • I'm Trish Triumpho Sullivan and I am dedicated to creating awesome public art in my community!  I am passionate about my art and have spent all of my life committed to making innovative art:: painting, sculpture, and photography.  I love Salinas and I want to make my town a better place to live, work and play. 
  • Reel Salinas is a cool trompe l'oeil art project portraying life-size characters from movies based on John Steinbeck's books and other films and film stars related to Salinas - they are going to be so awesome and I am really excited to be a part of positive change in my my community!  The lifelike sculptures will appear to be real - intriguing and educational to viewers experiencing the artworks.  The project will include an interactive smart phone app with historic content, mapping, video clips and other fascinating stories.  The series of 10 sculptures will be placed all over downtown Salinas to be discovered as one walks along Main Street.  Artworks will be adopted by local businesses and be taken indoors at night to protect against possible vandalism.
  • The Reel Salinas Public Art  project will have an incredible impact for downtown Salinas. Building community through innovative and inspirational art and sparking economic development by increasing visitation from locals and tourists. 


What We Need & What You Get

  • To create these sculptures, we need to raise at least $10,000 for materials, permits, insurance and royalties.  Materials will cost $8,000,  Permits, royalties and insurance will be $2,000.
  • Get excited! This is what you get when you join Reel Salinas and pARTicipate in our artistic journey:
  • Pledge $25 or more: Reel Salinas Smart Phone Tour with interactive map and video clips of the finished artworks. Featuring James Dean, Henry Fonda, Marilyn Monroe, Tallulah Bankhead, and many more. Value $2.99 Estimated delivery: Oct 2014

  • Pledge $50 or more: Reel Salinas T-Shirt with interactive link to the Reel Salinas Smart Phone Tour, featuring James Dean, Henry Fonda, Marilyn Monroe, Tallulah Bankhead, and many more. Value $20 Estimated delivery: Dec 2014

  • Pledge $100 or more: All of the above plus your name listed on the website as a supporter of the Reel Salinas Public Art Project. Estimated delivery: Dec 2014

  • Pledge $1000 or more: All of the above plus One original miniature maquette of actual artworks created for the project, Reel Salinas. Value $250 Estimated delivery: Dec 2014 

  • If I don’t reach the entire goal in this campaign, I will create as many sculptures as possible with the funding we have while continuing to fund raise and write for grants to finish the entire project.

The Impact

A bit more about the Reel Salinas campaign and the difference your contribution will make:

  • The Reel Salinas project is valuable to everyone in Salinas and as a contributor you are assured to be a part of the process from beginning to end.  These artworks will bring Salinas to the attention of the entire world, and help to create a new positive image for our beautiful city.
  • I have years of experience creating public art events that are free to the community.  I spend hundreds of hours per month volunteering to make Salinas a better place and increase civic pride in the community.  Please join me to make Reel Salinas happen and become a part of history - let's get our artistic journey started!
  •  I have lived here for over 30 years, have founded and continue to organize the 1st Fridays Art Walk, the annual day of the dead events in Salinas and One Salinas Youth Arts Festival - I am dedicated and here to improve my city and build community.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you just can’t contribute, you can still help to make Reel Salinas successful:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about the Reel Salinas Public Art campaign - post on Facebook, Twitter, and tell your friends via email and face to face - every little bit helps a lot!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to create a buzz about Reel Salinas!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to create a buzz about Reel Salinas!

story:
OPS-- The Organization for Prostitution Survivors-- is a grassroots non-profit that was started by survivors and their allies to stop the violence of prostitution. OPS works in three program areas: survivor services, community education, and men's accountability. By leading the community in healing the harm of prostitution, OPS will shift the social norms that support the practice of prostitution. OPS is both a social service agency and an agent of social change.                                  

 

Who are the Green River Victims?                                                                                         

More than 90 prostituted women and girls are presumed murdered by Gary Ridgway between 1981 and his arrest in 2001 in the Seattle area. He was charged with killing 49 identified victims more than half of whom were under the age of 18, and admitted to killing more that were never found or identified. 

Why create a memorial for the victims of the Green River Killer?                                           

This tragedy has gone unacknowledged for too long. Until the families of victims and survivors have experienced healing from these murders, our community as a whole cannot begin to heal. We must address the violence of prostitution that continues all around us. These victims deserve to be acknowledged!

 People often excuse the violence done to women and children in the life of prostitution as if they were asking for it or somehow brought it upon themselves. This attitude is similar to how people often think about women who experience domestic violence, rape, and sexual harassment and is known as victim blaming. The Green River Victims Memorial will help dispel the myths about prostitution that make blaming the victim so prevalent, and provide a place for future generations to learn from our painful past.

What is Phase One for the Green River Victims Memorial?

Phase One is about coming together through participatory art to create dialogue about the memorializing process in order to heal from this tragedy. From January 2013 until January of 2014, OPS will organize art workshops 3 times a week for survivors of prostitution for the full year. Workshops will be led by local artists in Seattle and will include opportunities in multiple media for survivors to engage with art in the healing process. OPS will also invite families of victims to participate alongside survivors in this process of restoration and active memorializing.

Phase Two will be the completion of the memorial.  In the first phase of this project we will NOT be constructing the physical public memorial.The form and location of the physical memorial is to be determined during phase 2. These decisions will grow from thePhase One workshops, gallery shows, and presentations to stakeholders in the community as we build support for the permanent memorial.. Phase One will produce a documentary video and an art book of images that will be included in the development plans for the permanent memorial. Physical copies of these will be available as perks for backers.

Why is it so important that we work with current survivors to do this memorial project? 

OPS believes that giving voice to survivors must be the drive for this memorial project. Through these experiences and healing via creative arts, survivors take on the lead role, guiding us forward and establishing the foundation for the permanent memorial. Survivors have lived to tell their stories and we have a lot to learn from their strength and tenacity. These women have a lot to contribute to our community and we need to welcome their stories and expession.

How will my pledge dollars be used?

Phase One is a year long journey. Your pledges will be used to create a safe space where survivors can explore the themes of healing and memorializing, as well as a gallery space to bring the art to the public. These explorations will take place through drawing, painting, sculpture, dance, poetry, movement and other creative arts. Funds will also help build support among stakeholders (families of the victims, city officials, community groups, arts organizations, etc.) through community presentations and trainings for completion of the permanent memorial

What will the permanent memorial look like? Where will it be?

These questions will ultimately be answered in Phase Two of the GRVM Project. Phase One focuses on working with survivors to discover the themes, explore the issues, and facilitate the dialogue between survivors and the other stakeholders in the community that will essentially serve as the foundation for the permanent memorial.

What is this the story behind the $10,000 perk level? A dry-eraser...really?

In the late 1960s and 1970's, German artist and activist Joseph Beuys pushed the boundaries of what is considered an "artwork" with his ideas about expanding the concept of art. The issues of social and environmental justice figured prominently in his advocacy that "everyone is an artist" and that through "social sculpture", a better world is possible. Beuys created a series of what he called "Chalk Talks" where he gave presentations about social and environmental issues and later sold the chalkboards that he used (or in some cases the erasers) as works of art. Much of Beuys' work anticipated contemporary liberation arts methodologies and the art of social practice. In homage to Beuys, OPS will use just one dry-eraser for all workshops and presentations and present it to just one lucky person at the end of Phase One.

In the late 1960s and 1970's, German artist and activist Joseph Beuys pushed the boundaries of what is considered an "artwork" with his ideas about expanding the concept of art. The issues of social and environmental justice figured prominently in his advocacy that "everyone is an artist" and that through "social sculpture", a better world is possible. Beuys created a series of what he called "Chalk Talks" where he gave presentations about social and environmental issues and later sold the chalkboards that he used (or in some cases the erasers) as works of art. Much of Beuys' work anticipated contemporary liberation arts methodologies and the art of social practice. In homage to Beuys, OPS will use just one dry-eraser for all workshops and presentations and present it to just one lucky person at the end of Phase One.

story:
The Keep Kaylee Flying Fund

Hey, this is Maya Dinerstein, also known as 'Ask Kaylee Frye' on Tumblr and Facebook.

For those of you who don't know, I am a cosplayer who dresses like Kaylee Frye from the TV series 'Firefly' and the movie Serenity. 

I've been told I look like Kaylee since freshman year of high school (almost 5 years now), but I only cosplayed her for the first time this past year, at New York Comic Con. The reception was astounding. I never imagined there were so many fans out there who would recognize me, let alone want to take a picture with me!

Shortly afterwards, I started this blog where I answer, in GIF format, questions sent in, as Kaylee. I've been busy recently, so there haven't been a lot, but I'm happy to say that I'll be starting up again soon, and there will be some very exciting guest stars in the near future.

 But let me cut to the chase:

I have started this IndieGogo campaign because a) I am a broke-ish college student who has to pay for food and textbooks and b) there are SO many comic conventions I want to go to, and cosplays I want to make (the next kaylee one being her dress from Out of Gas and The Message, which is made out of kimono fabric, which is not easy to get your hands on). I've got the time and the dedication, but what I lack is funds. 

Conventions cost a lot of money, for travel, lodging, food not to mention, the tickets to get in themselves. So, I figured I'd reach out. There are over a THOUSAND of you (wo-de-mah) on Facebook and Tumblr. I've set my goal at $1,000, which would let me go to a couple conventions in June, DragonCon in Atlanta in August, and New York Comic Con in October. These aren't all the conventions I'm planning on going to, but these are the big ones that will require all of the above. 

For anyone who donates, I have some real shiny stuff. 

-Any amount donated guarantees you a picture with me at any convention that we both attend

-For $3, I'll send a Kaylee themed friendship bracelet anywhere in the US (shipping internationally is a bit more, contact me if you're interested!) that looks something like this, though each one is unique and different.

-For $5, you're invited to attend an online viewing party (including video chat with yours truly, in costume!) of your choice of episode of Firefly. There will be 3 episodes screened a night, starting July 8th, time TBD.

-For $10, you're invited to attend an online viewing party (including video chat with yours truly, in costume!) of the movie Serenity, on July 14, time TBD /OR/ of the fan-sequel Browncoats Redemption (which will be the first time I see the film as well!)

-For $55, you're invited to an online viewing party of ALL the episodes of Firefly (including video chat with yours truly, in costume!), saving you $20 vs buying each episode.

-For $60, you're invited to an online viewing party of ALL the episodes of Firefly AND Serenity (including video chat with yours truly, in costume!), saving you $25 vs. buying individual episodes.

-For $65, you're invited to ALL of the viewing parties (including video chat with yours truly, in costume!), every episode of Firefly and the movies Serenity and Browncoats Redemption, saving you $30 vs. buying individuals.

 Every five dollars donated additionally enters you into a giveaway to win a big box of cool stuff, like toy dinosaurs, a Jayne hat knit by me, 'Miranda' soap from Lush (it smells amazing!) and more.

 In June,

I'll be doing a Kaylee pin-up shoot with FanGirl TV, and prints from that shoot will also be sold. Additionally, prizes will continue to be added as I think them up, and if you've got an idea for something you'd like, feel free to message me on Facebook.com/AskKayleeFrye

Any money I make that I don't use for conventions will be donated to my local pet shelter, Chicago Canine Rescue, and not spent on boring things like textbooks.

story:
What's this all about!

Justin Foo, 20 (left) and Yeo Tze Yang, 18 (right) are painters.

(Yeap we painted each other!)

Organising an exhibition from 28-30 June 2013. It will be located at Goodman Arts Centre, Gallery, Block B #01-08, Singapore. The closing reception will be on 29th June, 3-4PM.

This exhibition documents the approaches of two young painters towards the act of painting in Singapore today. The painters contemplate the inevitability of change and the persistence of memory in a place dominated by progress. Through the laborious and meditative process of painting, they strive to immortalise fleeting moments of meaning.

 

Your contributions will allow us to fulfill our dream of exhibiting our works like pros yippee!

 

Impact!

Not only will your help aid our passions greatly, it will also show that young emerging artists can have a chance to showcase their work in this cultural wasteland yay.

 

What We Need!

  • Canvas and Paint:$1040
  • Rental of Space: $810
    • Goodman Arts Centre
  • Set-up of Space: $300
    • Vinyl stickers 
  • Publicity: $150
    • Posters, postcards and brochures
  • Transport of Materials: $500
    • Delivery between studio and gallery
  • Opening: $100
  • Miscellaneous Costs: $200

 Total : S$3100 = US$2507

In Return...

  • $1: Virtual Hug
  • $5: Postcard
  • $20: Set of Postcards
  • $50: A3 Poster
  • $70: A4 Drawing
  • $100: Hand-bound Notebook
  • $200: Personalised A5 painting
  • $500: Personalised A3 painting
  • * all prices listed are in US$

 

How else you can help!

Share our event on Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo and everywhere else!

 

Contact us...

  • Phone

    • Tze Yang: +65 83064348
    • Justin: +65 96631686

  • Email

    • Tze Yang: ghghbh@gmail.com
    • Justin: justinfoozhikai@yahoo.com.sg

  • Portfolio

    • Tze Yang: http://yeotzeyang.portfoliobox.me
    • Justin: http://artfoo.tumblr.com/

 

By the way,

If you would rather collect your purchases at the exhibition at the Goodman Arts Centre Gallery (Singapore), just tell us!

When the exhibition ends, all contributors will receive a link to photographs of the show which they helped realise! :)

 

More about the paintings!

Yeo Tze Yang

In this series of paintings, I discarded all previous pretences I had with painting and engaged in intimate visual conversations between myself, my loved ones and the environment around me. The paintings attempt to express a similar mood to the viewer: one of quiet disillusionment, reflecting the general "Bo Pian" (no choice) attitude in Singapore. Despite the bleakness in my works, I still believe in the beauty and hope that lies in all the relentless unhappiness we face: that maybe someday things get better somehow, or that as long as we hold on to one another we could get through this together.

 

Justin Foo

By examining childhood photographs of family and friends, I begin to uncover their private memories. These ready-made images are first digitally distorted, before being interpreted through the medium of paint, blurring the line between historical and imagined narratives. The harsh geometric frames are countered by the gestural swathes of paint, which threaten to consume the figures whole. The subjects begin to reveal their loneliness and vulnerability, when caught amidst the oppositional forces of chaos and order.

story:
Introduction

For several years now, Postmortem Studios has been trying to help young or disadvantaged genre artists via the Zelart Scholarship.

Zel was a young artist we worked with on several projects, a man who should have had a great future in comics and illustration. For several years we paid him and helped him through his education until his life was tragically cut short in an accident.

In memory of Zel, and in recognition of how genre artists can have a hard time in education, and in making ends meet in life, we try to raise money to offer as a grant to a struggling artist. We strive to raise a minimum of $500 each year, providing promotion and opportunity along with the money, with each year's winner going on sale to aid the next year's fundraiser.

Your support can help someone get to the point of a successful career, or get them out of a hole. This year more than most.

What We Need & What You Can Do

We need your money to boost what we've made from previous winners being sold as stock art over the previous year. 

We try to make $500 to offer each year, it's not a huge amount, but it's significant enough to make a difference. That $500 can help keep a roof over someone's head, keep them in ramen noodles, or help replace a lost or broken computer or tablet.

If you can't help us out with raising the money but can make art yourself, we also accept donations in the form of art to be sold as stock art in order to raise money for next year. This is a great way to contribute in a more long-term way.

All the money goes to the artist who wins the scholarship, we cover any fees.

If the full amount is not raised, what has been raised will be passed on regardless.

story:
To start:    

My name is Stacey and I am a 26-year-old independent artist in Columbus, Ohio.

Last year, I was diagnosed with several chronic illnesses that managed to ruin every good thing I had going . My poor health pulled me out of school though I was very close to graduating, away from the best job I'd ever had, out of contact with a lot of my friends, and perhaps worst of all: away from my ability to make   art. To say the least, times have not been pleasant.

My progress with recovery is promising, however gradual. Recently I have felt inspired enough to scrape myself out of bed and start drawing, inking or painting. This is a huge step considering how embarrassingly long I've now been out of commission, but I want to keep fighting and push myself further. The goal is to finish a series of four 11x15 ink drawings featuring my most elaborate work to date, and submit them to a gallery by the end of this year.

 The theme of this series will be vitality. 

Unfortunately, nowadays I'm in a precarious situation; bills are starting to pile up around me and my health is not yet stable enough for me to go back to work. Despite how I'm never short on willpower, I am becoming dangerously short on funds. This artistic goal I've set is exactly what I need to get me out of this rut between now and the time when I'll be able to work again.. But I'm going to need some help-- that's where you come in.

How much? What for?

Basically, I need as much as I can get. I live pretty modestly in an inexpensive city, so some extra cash will go a long way for me! This money will be used for smaller expenses like art supplies as well as more significant expenses like rent. Regardless of whether I am able to make or exceed my goal funding amount of $600, all donations will be put toward necessities. 

What do you get?

As it is my intent to express sincere gratitude to anyone who will help me through these difficult times, all donors will be rewarded and greatly appreciated. Everyone wins! Check the 'perks' list for more details.

Why else?

It's worth mentioning that I've been pretty shy with my artwork and have never before shown anything to such a potentially large audience! While this will be unfamiliar territory for me, I figure there's no better time than now to finally bounce back and feel unashamed to share this success with everybody. 

Ultimately, I aim to become a more prolific, visible artist in this city. Perhaps there will be more gallery shows, perhaps someday I'll have my own exhibition.. Either way, it starts here. With your help, I'll be able to really throw myself into doing what makes me happiest, which means an awful lot for someone who has been able to do very little for such a long time. 

Sample artwork

Here are some thumbnails of work from years past:

 

 

Previews of the first piece in the series:

 

 

What else can you do?

If you like what you see and/or want to see more --even if you can't donate right now!-- please share this page with your friends via the Indiegogo share tools. I would really appreciate the extra support!

 

Thanks so much!

story:
We are participating for the first time in the annual Day of the Dead event in the Mission by building an altar that will be part of the little interactive illuminated village of altars in Garfield Park. When we decided to create an altar this year, we wanted to come up with a focus or specific theme for honoring the deceased. It seemed only appropriate to devote the altar to the many anonymous homeless people who perish on the streets of San Francisco and have few loved ones or often no one to memorialize them.

Our structure will be tiered with each tier propped up by 1 gallon cans of food, which will later be donated to a shelter. Each level will hold empty frames of various sizes to symbolize the nameless deceased who should be honored and paid the respects due to all in their passing. Candles and fresh marigolds, the traditional flower used to decorate Day of the Dead altars, will be interspersed between the frames.

We are in need of funding for building materials for the altar structure. As tier dividers we are utilizing large industrial size food cans which will be donated to a homeless shelter at the end of the event. All proceeds are going towards the project building or food can donations. Feel free to also bring food cans to the event and place them on the altar as an offering. 

We hope to see you out on Nov. 2!  The altar will be set up near the clubhouse. 

Thanks for your support and come find us at the event. Judith and Leta
