story:
Short Summary

We are K-Online Television, a Manchester- based entertainment company in pre-production for our first web series. We are all huge fans of Korean culture- the music, the dramas, the food. Our passion for this is shared by an increasing amount of people, who are all engaging with the Korean wave (Hallyu) as it grows across the UK. 

Mind Your Language is bold, heartfelt and innovative, dealing with a range of issues such as arranged marriages, race, identity conflict and family. It will also blend the conventions of Korean Dramas, cleverly navigating between light moments and emotional scenes, exploring love and relationships between many of the characters. The range of races represented in the drama highlights the modern racial makeup of non-Korean fans in the U.K. However, despite their differences in culture and upbringing, their common connection is their passion and celebration of Korean culture. 

Below are cast in the Korean language class and thier nationalities: 

Main Cast 

Teacher Kim - Korean

Sabrina - Pakistani 

Tanaka - Zimbabwean 

Mark - Korean/Zimbabwean  (mixed race)

Leo - Korean (adopted into the United Kingdom)

JC - Korean

Supporting cast 

Sara - English 

Hidam - Indian

Dante - Italian 

Han - Chinese

Cailin - Scottish

Natalia - Polish

Lin - Taiwanese 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise £3000. We are shooting the first three episodes in Manchester, and are looking to spend the money as follows:

£1200 on cast/ crew and their expenses.

£800 on extra equipment

£800 on locations

£200 for catering and consumables

Our unique perks are definitely something to shout about! We are offering giveaways, including bags and set-visits, and much, much more. 

The Impact

Help us make the first Korean inspired British web drama made by K-lovers for all K-lovers, which celebrates the Korean Wave and put colour in Korean dramas. 

Risks & Challenges

We have chosen to make this a flexible funding campaign. It is important for us to get going with the series, and if we don’t make our goal, we won’t try and stretch it too far, as we want it to be of the best quality. Instead, we will make 1  episode, and have that finished and ready. 

We have our cast and crew ready, and have a very structured plan moving forwards. Once episode one is funded, we will begin shooting as soon as possible.

If we make above and beyond our goal (fingers crossed!), we will make more episodes, and maybe even get the whole series funded. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t afford to contribute to the project, we totally understand! We would really appreciate if you could “like” our pages on social media, and check out our YouTube channel. If you could go a step further and post/ tweet about the campaign, using the IndieGoGo share tools, we’d be forever grateful!

Instagram - K_Online_Television

Twitter - K_Online_Tv

Facebook - K-Online Television 

YouTube - K-Online Television 

고맙습니다 (gomabseubnida) - Thank you.

£800 on extra equipment
£800 on locations
£200 for catering and consumables
Our unique perks are definitely something to shout about! We are offering giveaways, including bags and set-visits, and much, much more. 

The Impact
Help us make the first Korean inspired British web drama made by K-lovers for all K-lovers, which celebrates the Korean Wave and put colour in Korean dramas. 

Risks & Challenges
We have chosen to make this a flexible funding campaign. It is important for us to get going with the series, and if we don’t make our goal, we won’t try and stretch it too far, as we want it to be of the best quality. Instead, we will make 1  episode, and have that finished and ready. 
We have our cast and crew ready, and have a very structured plan moving forwards. Once episode one is funded, we will begin shooting as soon as possible.
If we make above and beyond our goal (fingers crossed!), we will make more episodes, and maybe even get the whole series funded. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t afford to contribute to the project, we totally understand! We would really appreciate if you could “like” our pages on social media, and check out our YouTube channel. If you could go a step further and post/ tweet about the campaign, using the IndieGoGo share tools, we’d be forever grateful!
Instagram - K_Online_Television
Twitter - K_Online_Tv
Facebook - K-Online Television 
YouTube - K-Online Television 
고맙습니다 (gomabseubnida) - Thank you.

story:
Get Bella to Art School

My name is Bella Emmerich and someday, with your help, I will be a great artist.

I am 16 years old and I live in Napa California. My mom always says I was practically born with a crayon in my hand. Art is what I am meant to do. 

Recently I was accepted to Oxbow School; Oxbow is an amazing one semester long art intensive program for high school juniors and seniors. Oxbow School is located in Napa California, and students from all over the United States (and sometimes even further) apply to the school; only the best young artists are accepted and I was lucky enough to be one of them.

If I receive enough funds to attend Oxbow I will live on campus, with about 43 other lucky students, for about four months and have an experience of a life time. Not only will I meet many other students just like me from all over the United States, go to many museums, and meet famous artists, I will also grow immensely as an artist and student from the training they will give me.

Oxbow School tuition is $23,000 per student; a big price to pay but worth every penny. This money will pay for my room and board on campus along with all school expenses and art supplies; fieldtrips, visiting artists, gallery entry fees, and many other things will be covered by the donation money I receive through indiegogo.com/getbellatoartschool.

Here is Oxbow Schools website if you are interested in learning more: http://oxbowschool.org/index.html

In addition to knowing you have helped me come one step closer to getting to the art school of my dreams, I am offering many great perks to anyone who donates to the cause! By helping out you could receive a mix CD, a thank you letter, or a one of a kind print or painting by Bella. Who knows maybe someday when my art is hanging in the MET (Metropolitan Museum of Art), the piece you have will be worth millions!

I have dreamed of attending Oxbow since I was in grade school, if you could help me achieve my dream I would be more than grateful. If you can donate, please do. However some people just can’t contribute, and that is perfectly okay; you can still help. Get the word out by telling your friends about my campaign!  

Go spread the word and get Bella to school!

Thank you!

story:
About Me:

Hello Everyone I am Karen!

Growing up I never had the typical dream of becoming a ballerina, doctor, or police officer. Instead I have always wanted to be an Artist! To share my artwork with the world and make people happy threw my talent has ALWAYS been a dream that has burned deep within my soul. I have always been blessed with great artistic ability, being able to draw, paint, sculpt, craft, and everything else in between. I refurbish, recreate, and restore furniture.  I have been in multiple Art shows, competitions, and juried exhibitions, I have been awarded Scholarships and have had my work purchased for collections. I have worked hard and meticulously on my artwork but my dream does not stop there!

I want to open up my own Art studio so that every artist in my community, young and old, has everything they need to achieve their own dreams. I want to light the fire within our children and adults that have given up their dreams because they don’t have a place to work, the materials they need, the support they deserve, and the platform to achieve their true potential.

However being a mother of two I find it difficult to sometimes follow my dreams. Putting my children fist I often do not have the extra money I need to achieve my goals. I want nothing more than to conquer this challenge and help others artist achieve their dreams as well! My campaign is just for that!

 

Why This is Important to Me and The Community:

In today’s day and age were more and more people are living in poverty, struggling to keep their homes and jobs, and families are faced with the decision to put gas in the car or food on the table, is not only a fact of life now but will also impact the opportunity’s our children and subsequently ourselves have in the future.

The effects of a poor economy does not just hit once then recover overnight, it lingers and rumbles like an earthquake for generations to come. Our children are at risk for not being able to experience the things we once did when we were children. Many Schools are faced with funding cuts and Art, sports, and Music are the first things to go. Whole generations of artist are at risk because of the effects of this bad economy. I want not only my kids but every child in the world to know that dreams really do come true.

 

What We Can do Together:

Your support would not only help me achieve my dreams but also help other artist achieve theirs too! By donating to this campaign you will be helping in the following ways:

Your Money:

  • Help lease/Rent a space for the Art Studio 
  • Help buy art supplies to get off the ground
  • Help buy tables, chairs and other equipment
  • Help buy transportation for transporting large scale artwork and equipment
  • Help pay for advertising

What I Will Do to Say Thank you:

  • Donate $10.00 - $40.00 and I will send you a Personal Letter of Thanks!
  • Donate $50.00 and I will draw and/or paint you a one of a Kind Postcard!
  • Donate $100.00 and I will personally create you a one of a kind small piece of artwork (9x12)
  • Donate $300.00 and I will personally create you a one of a kind medium piece of artwork (12x18)
  • Donate $500.00 and I will personally create you a one of a kind large piece of artwork (18x24)

If We Go Above and Beyond My Fundraising Goal:

I will not only cry with joy but I will also dedicate one of the walls in the art studio to everyone who has donated. Creating a mural of every single person’s name that helped me achieve this Dream!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

I understand that some people just can’t contribute and that’s ok. But that doesn’t mean you can’t help! The following are ways that you too can help:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Like me on Facebook and Share it with your friends
  • Follow me on Twitter

story:
WHY DO WE MATTER?

Beltway Poetry Slam is  one of DC's premier spots for performance poetry and art in general. Over the past three years, Beltway has brought new and seasoned poets to the stage, featuring award winning talent from across the country and gaining the attention of local media and arts organizations.  We are gearing up to send our third ever team to compete at the National Poetry Slam in Boston and we need your help getting there! 

TEAM MEMBERS: Pages Matam, Natalie E. Illum, Adele Hampton, Robalu Gibson, Clint Smith. COACH Chris August 

WHY DO YOU MATTER?
Beltway is thrilled that we have been able to send two prior teams to the National Poetry Slam, both placing in the top 20. But getting there is not cheap. Registration alone is $500, plus lodging and travel for  a nearly week-long affair. Raising the money from this campaign will only be a fraction of what it costs to send a team, but it will help close the gap in the current budget and allow the team to get there without personal financial burden.

Please take a moment to think about the impact that the Beltway Poetry Slam community has had on you.  Whether you have attended one show, have friends who are involved or on the team or have been a loyal groupie from the start, we value anything you are able to give at this time.  We have been able to keep the cost of our monthly show low (only $5!!) despite it costing nearly 30 times that to put on a show each month because we believe in being a welcoming space for everyone in the community. If you have the capacity to give at this time, even at the cost of entry to one show, it will make an impact on getting to our goal!

Gifts at all levels are greatly greatly appreciated! 
Questions? beltwayslam@gmail.com 

Tweet About Us: @BeltwaySlamDC

story:
What is Deathmension

A veteran's 18 year attempt to live a normal life in a small town grows amiss when an invitation to a local screening opens the door to terrifying memories. What awaits him is a menacing figure from his past, the junction between a thriller and his twisted mind. Both a short and the core of The Deathmension Experience, it will be a double-edged sword of haunting visuals and sound design that will stun audiences.

Deathmension Trailer

Meet The Veteran

Known by many for his role in the Texas Chainsaw Massacre, and by few for his service in the Vietnam Conflict, Ed Neal is both a recognizable face in the horror genre and can easily incorporate his own experiences into the character he plays. Upon completion of the Deathmension short, Ed looks forward to the 4th wall tour cycle that is The Deathmension Experience.

"The "Texas Chainsaw Massacre" hitchhiker really made people never want to hitchhike again."

- John Waters

What Is The Deathmension Experience

Using Virtual Reality (VR) and theatrical performance to amplify the narrative of the short film, The Deathmension Experience puts the audience in a haunted house-style LIVE attraction. While the purpose of VR is to put you in the same theater and mindset as the veteran, the real shock lies in the climax that The Deathmension Experience has to offer. Our process of combining these story telling mediums is referred to as ImmersoScope. You can view our earliest ImmersoScope test by clicking here.

The resources that we have accessible to The Deathmension Experience and the roadshow unit have since then grown in quality, and we plan to give all of you investors exclusive access to these developments

What is The Deathmension Roadshow Unit 

The Deathmension Experience is an effort that involves transforming an entire theater. The roadshow unit is simply a mobile version of this concept which occupies a fraction of the space while maintaining the entirety of the experience. Through the combination of 180° projection and 3D sound, this one-seat build is a fantastic way to draw attention to The Deathmension Experience and all of the many people that it consists of. 

What The Deathmension Means To Us 

Since the conception of blending 3 story telling mediums to terrify audience members, this project has since evolved into a social good 

  • Awareness and development has been invested in more than 8 small-town theaters
  • Collaboration with the Wounded Warriors Project is underway for a Veteran's Day event
  • Revitalizing the economy of and inspiring local film productions in Taylor Texas

What We Learned From Our Kickstarter

Our original goal was $5.000. That amount would have comfortably secured The Deathmension Experience tour with 8 small town theaters. Due to Kickstarter's all or nothing structure, we have instead raised $1,705 and gained nothing. If we can raise this number on Indigogo, we can:

  • Conduct a screening of The Deathmension Exerience at the same theater we filmed it 
  • Create the roadshow unit 
  • Get out rewards to investors old and new

What Deathmension Means to You

The relevance of Virtual Reality and the combination story telling mediums is becoming all the more relevant with people such as Francis Ford Coppola pursuing similar projects to The Deathmension Experience at the expense of far more time and resources:

  • When you invest in The Deathmension Experience, you invest in one of the very first projects to tap into this style of story-telling in a fittingly unconventional way
  • With the combined forces of professionals in the film-making, Virtual Reality, and live theater, a flavor is added that the majority of first time filmmakers simply don't have. 
  • Above all else, you are creating a platform which boasts multiple types of creative expression, and groups that benefit social wellbeing 

Risks & Challenges

Deathmension is a powerful short film on it's own. The Deathmension Experience is created to immerse you, the viewer, completely in the unhinged mind of The Veteran by allowing art to imitate life... to imitate art.

Our biggest risk is failing to provide you, our supporters, with that full experience.

Whether we are able to raise enough funding to provide one or more experiences, booking theater space, talent, and props required to share this unique movie-going experience with you is costly. Our ultimate goal is to bring The Deathmension Experience to festivals and conventions worldwide. While the roadshow unit will make that goal easier to pursue, we can't make that possible without you, the investors. 

If our Indigogo campaign is unsuccessful, the pursuit of The Deathmension Experience, and it's accompanying roadshow unit may be affected. We are highly confident that this film will be complete before March 2017 and ready for a live theater exhibition during Mental Illness Awareness Week (MIAW). This will include all the rewards and awesome stuff we've got waiting for you.

Ultimately, the creative team behind this project has completed many great films and plan on completing many more in the future. We are dedicated to you and to getting this project finished with the highest quality possible. We want our names attached to nothing less than Spectacular!! We assure you, in lending your name to our final vision, you are committing to Greatness! Thank you so much again for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

There a a few other ways that you can be a part of the Deathmension family that don't cost as much:

  • Share our Indigogo and any of our posts on social media with the hashtag #Deathmension

  • Connect with us on your favorite means of social media by searching for PsychoBastardo

  • Visit our website to find even more content and ways to get involved at Deathmension.com

Connect with us on your favorite means of social media by searching for PsychoBastardo
Visit our website to find even more content and ways to get involved at Deathmension.com

story:
It's that time again.

What a year to walk off the steam from headaches and headlines.

Taking walks and making things are central to my happiness. The Decorah valley is a fantastic place to do both. Each month is an illustration of a local landmark that I wanted to share. If you don't immediately recognize it, there are hints in the title. The locations are an invitation to go explore a little more in Decorah. The fresh air is the reward.

You can choose to leave this calendar as a pristine collection of line drawings. But you can also get out your pens, pencils, and paints and make something uniquely yours. Then you have an entire month to enjoy your work. So visit the landmark of each month - both indoors and outside.

Take your time.

 

About the project and Raabe Studio

This project is all about exploration. The calendar size is 12"x 18" and is a folio of 12 loose prints delivered in a sturdy mailer folder. Each print has a convenient dot centered at the top for your pushpin to hang each month in your home or office. Color it with your friends, children, grandparents, roommates or someone new in your life. Do them now, or one each month.

Raabe Studio is a design and photo studio run by designer and photographer Jay Raabe, from the heart of Decorah, Iowa. Every week I am out walking, running, and exploring Decorah and this project is a celebration of my favorite activities: exploring and making.

I have chosen some of my favorite spots that grab your attention around town and distilled them into the 52101 Walking Decorah calendar to share with you. Personalize your calendar and make it as realistic or funky as you see fit. I am particularly excited to see calendar owners share their work online throughout the year - tag your work with #walkingdecorah.

My intent for this project is to share my love of the bits and details of our town, but it also acts as an invitation to slow down and enjoy yourself for a moment. We appreciate things more that we have created with our own hands and sharing that experience with you means a lot to me. Take some time and see what happens.

Your Support Matters

Even if you can't help with a purchase, please take some time and enjoy this project as it evolves throughout the year. Talk about this project with others and spread the word about the things you found interesting.

Follow Raabe Studio (@raabestudio) https://www.instagram.com/raabestudio/ and keep posting your artwork and adventures!

Tag and post images of your work to share: #walkingdecorah and #raabestudio 

Timeline & Delivery

This campaign will go until a week before Christmas and then we go to the printer (Luther College print services, local, of course). My focus is to deliver these locally by Christmas for gifting, and will contact you with the Decorah pick-up date. My next priority is getting the mailed orders to those outside Winneshiek County by January 1 in anticipation of the new year. You will be contacted with details soon after the end of this campaign - Dec 16th.

I will keep you posted on print progress and delivery dates. Thank you for your support!

IMPORTANT - When ordering, please choose the "local" version of a perk if you are in Decorah or a friend/family that I will be delivering to directly. This will avoid being charged for shipping.

Take some time and see what happens.Your Support MattersEven if you can't help with a purchase, please take some time and enjoy this project as it evolves throughout the year. Talk about this project with others and spread the word about the things you found interesting.Follow Raabe Studio (@raabestudio) https://www.instagram.com/raabestudio/ and keep posting your artwork and adventures!Tag and post images of your work to share: #walkingdecorah and #raabestudio Timeline & DeliveryThis campaign will go until a week before Christmas and then we go to the printer (Luther College print services, local, of course). My focus is to deliver these locally by Christmas for gifting, and will contact you with the Decorah pick-up date. My next priority is getting the mailed orders to those outside Winneshiek County by January 1 in anticipation of the new year. You will be contacted with details soon after the end of this campaign - Dec 16th.I will keep you posted on print progress and delivery dates. Thank you for your support!IMPORTANT - When ordering, please choose the "local" version of a perk if you are in Decorah or a friend/family that I will be delivering to directly. This will avoid being charged for shipping.

story:
The concept

The idea behind the Vincent Vega project is pretty simple: when “I” becomes “we” everything is possible! With that in mind, a group of friends decided to embark on an exciting project of building a versatile center for aspiring, creative people. 

As Greece has entered the fifth year of one of the worst economic recessions in its modern history, creativity and innovation have become the only solution to moving forward. Lots of great ideas have either been stalled at birth or progressed at an extremely slow pace due to lack of support. 

That’s what we want to change. What we offer is an opportunity for everyone to take that first step towards realizing their dreams. We all remember our own first steps: how hard it was to grasp all the non-romantic parts of being an entrepreneur; getting our ideas, products, creations out there, bureaucratic obstacles, high costs, lack of understanding and so on

The only thing we demand is be passionate about what you do and smile. Together we can make that first exhibition, product testing, or meeting with a potential investor happen. There are quite a few places in Athens that provide great equipment with well decorated spaces for such purposes. 

What is different about us is we offer the whole new and unique experience for free, you won’t have to pay a thing to share your inspirations with the world. 

We will also work alongside you to create an entire event around your ideas, hobbies, and passions Walls don’t create great things, people do!



The team

Our team is well experienced and all of us have worked for more than 10 years in our respective fields. What makes us invincible though is our absolute determination and love for what we do. We believe in team spirit, we believe in sacrifice for a common goal. We have developed a sound strategy to implement along the entire range of our services in order to be able to keep our word and never charge any fees for providing our space for exhibits, presentations etc. We believe by utilizing our knowledge and great team work ethic we will be able to achieve our goals.


Who will benefit

While developing the concept and discussing different ideas we have become absolutely infatuated with the number of great advantages we could offer the community. For the general public it is a great place to come and have a relaxing time, whether day or night, you can enjoy a meal prepared by our Italian chef, or a beverage as well as our own signature cocktails while enjoying a live performance, exhibition or just nice music.

For the neighborhood it creates a lot more exposure and brings new crowds thus helping local businesses and establishments. For the creative and aspiring individuals it is a chance to show their work, share and discuss ideas, or take part in the development of new creations with the Vincent Vega brand.So, pretty much anyone with the right spirit can benefit. And by the right spirit we mean just one thing be passionate!



The place and financial background

The Vincent Vega center will be located in one of the most diverse areas of downtown Athens, Exarhia. A two level commercial space in a beautiful neo classical building is to become the home of innovation and creativity. 

The area has many educational establishments making it one of the youngest areas age wise. It also has museums, book stores, bars and restaurants.
The building is centrally located as it is on a main street, right next to a hotel and the main square  Our architect and interior designer came up with the idea of building the place in the spirit of the Rock and Roll era and we all embraced it as we believe it captures the spirit of the Vincent Vega project .

As we moved forward we faced some substantial and unforeseen expenditure and subsequently ran out of budget. While a bank loan is practically impossible at the current market in Greece, and private investors demand high returns and collateral, we decided that in reality the only way to do it right is through crowd funding. This way we can focus on our vision for the project rather than high yields for our investors. We certainly plan to be profitable, but not at the expense of what Vincent Vega stands for.

So, dear Indiegogo community, please help us make this wonderful idea a reality! Once the budget is ensured we need three months to complete the construction and we’ll be ready to “Rock n Roll.” You can follow our progress on our FB page as well as Twitter, Instagram, and Youtube!

If you are not in a position to pledge, no worries just spread the word!


Here are some of the merchandise that our pledgers will receive as a thank you for their support. (Please note that some of the actual merchandise may vary slightly.)



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Visit our website and FB page

http://www.vincentvega.gr/

https://www.facebook.com/VincentVegaGreece


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Credits

PARTICIPATING ARTISTS
Corina Nika

http://www.cocorrina.com/


Panayiotis Diplaras (Diplines)

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Diplines/206885706030068

http://diplines.deviantart.com/


Alexandra Tsirou

http://atsirouphotos.blogspot.fr/

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

3D ANIMATION
Daniel Velentzas


POST PRODUCTION
Kostas Koufiopoulos (Serial Filmers)

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Serial-Filmers/382047751887772?ref=hl


DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
Dimitris Kalogeris

https://www.facebook.com/dimitris.kalogeris?fref=ts


MAKEUP ARTIST
Roula Katsiki

https://www.facebook.com/roula.katsiki?fref=ts

story:
A little bit about Art Links ...

Art Links is a six-day exhibition that offers us all an opportunity to learn about art, creativity and creative living.  Art Links includes work from over 50 different artists – painters, sculptors, photographers, writers, musicians, dancers, fashion designers and comedians all come together to share their creative lives with us all.

Art Links is an international art collective; a community united through creativity. We showcase art that awakens the creative spirit in the artist and the beholder; art which engages us as a connected society.




Help give Art Links a home!

We are asking our friends, families, supporters and the IndieGoGo community to help us fund the venue for this amazing creative event. Your contributions will provide a platform for over 50 international artists, musicians, writers and creatives to come together and share their creative ideas, passions and lives with us all.


What We Need

€15,327

We ask you to help Art Links have a home; a place where we can all come together as a community and celebrate our creative lives. Help us create a platform from which we can all share that creative spirit which resides within us all.

This is the cost of our venue – The HUB Events in Athens, Greece. This is an amazing venue and a perfect fit for Art Links with a theatre on the first floor for all our special events and bands and plenty of space with amazing light upstairs for exhibiting our artists’ work as well as hosting our workshops and the Art Links art auction for Make-A-Wish Greece (Κάνε-Μια-ΕυχήΕλλάδος) - our official charity which we are supporting with proceeds from ticket sales. 

This is the total that we owe after having paid our deposit of €3,000. We are asking you to help us with this one specific area of this exciting event! All other expenses, excluding the venue, for Art Links are being funded through official financial and media sponsorships.

All money raised here, whether or not we reach our goal, through IndieGoGo will be applied directly to our venue expense.

If we exceed our goal (YES!), Art Links will apply those extra funds towards marketing and advertising expenses ... extra advertising means more people get to experience the creative community at Art Links - Athens 2014.

In this way all money raised here at IndieGoGo will go towards creating a home for Art Links as well as allowing more people in our community the opportunity to join us at this amazing festival of art!



What You Get

In return for your support and generosity, we would like to offer you a little something as our way of saying ‘Thanks for the love!’

   €1

Art Links will give you a shout out of thanks on our Facebook page!

    €10 (the above ...  PLUS!)

Art Links will add your name to our Friends of Art Links page on our website.

€25 (all of the above ...  PLUS!)

Art Links will send you an Art Links compilation cd/dvd* filled with

  • special digital issues of Serendipity Magazine
  • digital copy of the Art Links official Exhibition Book
  • select videos from live events at Art Links
  • shots of the artwork from our exhibiting artists

€50 (all of the above ... PLUS!)

Art Links will send you two invitations to the opening night party on 17 October as well as two tickets to any event of your choosing. If you do not live in Greece, Art Links will send you videos of two special events**.

**Events ... we intend to offer video footage from our opening night partly, certain live performances, our closing night celebration and more! These videos will be available AFTER Art Links, and sent in December 2014, to allow for production time.

€100 (all of the above PLUS!)

Art Links will get you published! Your name and photo (photo is optional!) will appear in Serendipity Magazine – Special Issue Art Links, dedicated to all our live events, exhibiting artists and supporters. This issue will be published on 30 December 2014. This is a special edition and you will receive a pdf version of the issue to keep. 

€150 (all of the above PLUS!)

Art Links will also include your name as a key supporter in our Art Links Supporters video to be presented on the YouTube channel. This video will be shared via all our social media - Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Blogger, and our website, as well as be embedded online within Serendipity Magazine – Special Issue Art Links, to be published online on 30 December 2014.

€300 (all of the above PLUS!)

Art Links will send you a hard copy of the special issue of Serendipity Magazine promoting Art Links, its artists and its events, as well as a hard copy of the official Exhibition Book – featuring all our artists, musicians and speakers. Both publications are in full glossy color and are absolutely beautiful additions to your art publication collection.

Also, Art Links will donate 25€ to Make-A-Wish Greece(Κάνε-Μια-Ευχή Ελλάδος)  in your name.

*Please note the gifts that include videos, articles, and other relevant live Art Links material can only be presented AFTER the exhibition in October 2014, to allow for their creation during or immediately after Art Links. Delivery dates are available within the perk boxes on the right.




The Impact

We are building an international art collective with Art Links. Creatives from around the world are coming together in Athens this October to share their artistic passions through music, painting, photography, dance, fashion, books, sculpture, comedy and more! Join us and help Art Links to:

  • show that in a time of crisis around our world we value art and creativity as a way to express ourselves and connect with one another with a more profound understanding
  • share our experiences and tell our stories through art
  • explore new creative adventures together
  • encourage us all to live a more creative life!

Risks & Challenges

As with any creative adventure, there are risks and challenges to overcome. As this is the first Art Links exhibition, we have encountered many indeed! There are dozens of artists and performers to coordinate, visitors to please, and details to finalize. 

With each hiccup on our journey, we have taken our time and tried to understand the possibilities before moving forward with our solution. This process has served us well thus far. Of course, we envision other challenges in our future - we can meet them together as a community and as the Art Links team.

Art Links - Athens 2014 .... is happening! We are determined to direct our efforts to create the most successful and positive art festival in Athens this year!!

The Art Links community includes you. We need your support, encouragement and positive energy ... Please, join us and become a part of something truly amazing and positive for our world.


Other Ways You Can Help Art Links - Athens 2014

We know that not everyone who would like to support Art Links - Athens 2014 can give financially. There are other ways you could help us!

  • Like Art Links on Facebook and share our posts and announcements with your friends and on your own pages
  • Follow Serendipity Magazine on Twitter and retweet Art Links announcements for us!
  • Join our mailing list and share our news with others!
  • And please ... take advantage of the share tools provided here by IndieGoGo

Thank you so much for your support and encouragement - together we can create a chain reaction that can help us all to build a more positive and creative world  ...  one link at a time.

story:
25/03/2014 - UPDATE

We have added new items to the tiers. 
If you have a portfolio or website and donate £5 or more, we will add that link to your contributor mention.
ALL donations of £5 and above will be entered into a prize draw to win either a shoot with us for publication in our magazine, OR 3 months free directory advertising in the magazine. The winner will get to choose.
The winner will be chosen at random the day after the campaign finishes.

About Million Models Magazine

Million Models Magazine was created by myself Paul Bryan and my partner Alice Howard as a joint venture into the media industry.
By trade I am a Photographer and Alice a graphic designer, for a long time we have both wanted to get into the industry and this was our first foray into this world.

Initially this started as an idea in the tail end of 2013, as a way for models and photographers to get featured in a publication and be seen by an audience that may never have heard of them before.
This gradually grew and we wanted to invest our own experiences into the magazine, so we offered small shoots with a couple of models and it all began to grow from there.
We now host our own photo shoots every month, with a variety of wonderful creatives, ranging from Models, MUA's and Hair Stylists. All the way to Fashion Designers and Jewelers.

Our Modelling section houses photo shoots from other talented Photographers and Models, including interviews with the people themselves. These are sure to give you an inside look at the thought process behind these works.

We are branching into Fashion and Lifestyles due to public demand, which will mean interviews with some of the upcoming stars of the Fashion Industry, as well as tips on current trends.
Our Lifestyle section offers readers a light hearted approach to health and beauty, including informative and fun editorials from some of the countries hottest bloggers.

Million Models Magazine also sits on the cutting edge of technology, whether it's an amazing new phone, camera or audio device, we will give you the run down on what's hot and what's not.
This includes cool items we have been sent by the companies themselves to give you a full and honest review.

We Love Our Readers!

Our awesome readers have really helped to craft 'Million Models Magazine' into what has become a well regarded, informative and entertaining publication.
We are open to the communities ideas and opinions through various social media sites like Facebook and Twitter. This helps to keep us on track of what we want to offer our readers and how we can improve in further issues.

Our Objective

Our objective is to be THE magazine choice for Modelling, Fashion and Lifestyle! 

Million Models Magazine provides an information platform for aspiring and established models, the industry agencies, photographers, make up artists, retouchers and stylists. 

Million Models Magazine provides our readers with invaluable information such as:

  • Modelling 
  • Fashion 
  • Beauty 
  • Lifestyles
  • Opportunities
  • News
  • Events 
  • Beauty and Photographic product reviews
  • Interviews 
  • Styling Tips 
  • Agencies 
  • Photographers
  • and much more. 

Why are we using IndieGoGo?

Everything that the magazine has achieved so far, has been through the pure dedication and hard work from Alice and I (even though she has to wake up at 4am every morning for her day job! Bless her).
All shoots, props, and equipment so far has come out of our own pockets, using funds that quite frankly, we don't have. 

IndieGoGo gives us the opportunity to up our game and take it to the next level, enabling the magazine to transcend it's current form and keep growing.
Every donation is very much appreciated, from the teeny tiniest one, to the jaw dropping huge ones.

What will you use the money for?

Between 4 and 9% of all funds first of all will be taken by IndieGoGo and then another 3% + $25 will go to processing fees. 
The rest will be used to fund necessary equipment that will enable us to keep putting out our own high quality photographic material from our photo shoots. 
As well as offering a better user experience for our readership.

This will include:

  • Strobe lights (our current ones are rather ancient)
  • A better quality camera lens
  • New back drops 
  • Hiring of new and interesting UK shoot locations 
  • A redesigned website

Most likely forgetting something here, but rest assured all funds will be going directly back into equipment and resources to make the magazine even better!

What if I can't donate? :(

Even if you can't donate, don't worry, you can still help the campaign by sharing this on any of the social media sites. 
A cheeky Tweet wouldn't go amiss! 

Feel free to add us on Twitter: @millionmodelsuk 

Follow us on Instagram: @millionmodelsuk 

Also follow us on Pinterest: @millionmodelsuk

Thank you if you have read it to this point. It means a lot to us. 

Share if you can and lets hope we meet our goal!
story_txt:
25/03/2014 - UPDATEWe have added new items to the tiers. If you have a portfolio or website and donate £5 or more, we will add that link to your contributor mention.ALL donations of £5 and above will be entered into a prize draw to win either a shoot with us for publication in our magazine, OR 3 months free directory advertising in the magazine. The winner will get to choose.The winner will be chosen at random the day after the campaign finishes.About Million Models MagazineMillion Models Magazine was created by myself Paul Bryan and my partner Alice Howard as a joint venture into the media industry.By trade I am a Photographer and Alice a graphic designer, for a long time we have both wanted to get into the industry and this was our first foray into this world.Initially this started as an idea in the tail end of 2013, as a way for models and photographers to get featured in a publication and be seen by an audience that may never have heard of them before.This gradually grew and we wanted to invest our own experiences into the magazine, so we offered small shoots with a couple of models and it all began to grow from there.We now host our own photo shoots every month, with a variety of wonderful creatives, ranging from Models, MUA's and Hair Stylists. All the way to Fashion Designers and Jewelers.
Our Modelling section houses photo shoots from other talented Photographers and Models, including interviews with the people themselves. These are sure to give you an inside look at the thought process behind these works.We are branching into Fashion and Lifestyles due to public demand, which will mean interviews with some of the upcoming stars of the Fashion Industry, as well as tips on current trends.Our Lifestyle section offers readers a light hearted approach to health and beauty, including informative and fun editorials from some of the countries hottest bloggers.Million Models Magazine also sits on the cutting edge of technology, whether it's an amazing new phone, camera or audio device, we will give you the run down on what's hot and what's not.This includes cool items we have been sent by the companies themselves to give you a full and honest review.We Love Our Readers!Our awesome readers have really helped to craft 'Million Models Magazine' into what has become a well regarded, informative and entertaining publication.We are open to the communities ideas and opinions through various social media sites like Facebook and Twitter. This helps to keep us on track of what we want to offer our readers and how we can improve in further issues.Our ObjectiveOur objective is to be THE magazine choice for Modelling, Fashion and Lifestyle! Million Models Magazine provides an information platform for aspiring and established models, the industry agencies, photographers, make up artists, retouchers and stylists. Million Models Magazine provides our readers with invaluable information such as:
Modelling 
Fashion 
Beauty 
Lifestyles
Opportunities
News
Events 
Beauty and Photographic product reviews
Interviews 
Styling Tips 
Agencies 
Photographers
and much more. 

Why are we using IndieGoGo?Everything that the magazine has achieved so far, has been through the pure dedication and hard work from Alice and I (even though she has to wake up at 4am every morning for her day job! Bless her).All shoots, props, and equipment so far has come out of our own pockets, using funds that quite frankly, we don't have. IndieGoGo gives us the opportunity to up our game and take it to the next level, enabling the magazine to transcend it's current form and keep growing.Every donation is very much appreciated, from the teeny tiniest one, to the jaw dropping huge ones.What will you use the money for?Between 4 and 9% of all funds first of all will be taken by IndieGoGo and then another 3% + $25 will go to processing fees. The rest will be used to fund necessary equipment that will enable us to keep putting out our own high quality photographic material from our photo shoots. As well as offering a better user experience for our readership.This will include:
Strobe lights (our current ones are rather ancient)
A better quality camera lens
New back drops 
Hiring of new and interesting UK shoot locations 
A redesigned website
Most likely forgetting something here, but rest assured all funds will be going directly back into equipment and resources to make the magazine even better!What if I can't donate? :(Even if you can't donate, don't worry, you can still help the campaign by sharing this on any of the social media sites. A cheeky Tweet wouldn't go amiss! 
Feel free to add us on Twitter: @millionmodelsuk Follow us on Instagram: @millionmodelsuk Also follow us on Pinterest: @millionmodelsukThank you if you have read it to this point. It means a lot to us. Share if you can and lets hope we meet our goal!

story_txt: jj

story:
Who Are We and What Do We
 Think We're Doing?

We are Kristina and Aaron Beck and we have a vision. Our vision is to create a digital magazine that showcases and celebrates what a beautiful and amazing place the world is and supports artists and creators. 

We believe that the world is full of brilliant and talented people doing creative and inspiring things and we aspire to fill our hearts and minds (and tablets) with the art, expansive ideas, poetry, music, video, sculpture and photography of these people.  


Sounds Great, So What's the Plan?

We have developed Inspire U Magazine, a monthly multimedia publication for your digital device (initially iPad, followed by Kindle and Android tablets) that is designed to capitalize on the unique creative potential of the Tablet Magazine genre and beautify your life.

What Does This Magazine Do?

This magazine is designed to do Two things:

  • First- to collect in every issue an assortment of people, projects, places and ideas that are cool, beautiful, creative and inspirational and present them to our readers in a format that is aesthetically pleasing and entertaining. Every issue is designed to leave you feeling uplifted!                                                                           
  • Second- (and this is important) Inspire U Magazine is intended to be a place for people to showcase their creative work. We appreciate that lots of people are pursuing various skills and talents purely for the joy of being creative and we think that this is really cool. Everybody is an artist in some way and Inspire U Magazine seeks out the creative work of artists as well as regular everyday people and gives them a platform to share their work with a wide and diverse audience.    

We want Inspire U Magazine to leave you feeling like this!


So Where is it At?

We have been working on this idea for over a year and have laid a lot of the groundwork required to get this project off the ground. In the past year we have:

  • Developed the concept thoroughly both from the design and aesthetic of the magazine itself to the business model with an eye towards long term stability.
  • Developed a companion website to help us communicate with our readership. ( www.inspireumagazine.com )
  • Generated an enthusiastic response from many contributors working in a variety of different mediums which has allowed us to put together a series of preliminary issues.
  • Received positive feedback  from people who have seen the prototype of the magazine 
  • Become Apple Developers and have had a preliminary version of the App approved for the Apple App Store.
  • Learned the variety of different Software Packages and User Platforms required to turn content into a magazine and publish it to various digital platforms.                               


Whew! Now What?

We Would Love Your Support !  

Now we launch! Moving forward from here we are asking for your help to get us off to a running start! This campaign is designed to give us the resources we need  to operate for a 6 month period after which we plan on having revenue from subscriptions pay for the magazine.

Our monthly costs ($5000/mo) include:

  • Access fees for the publishing platform
  • Cost per download for the content
  • Hosting
  • Advertising (so that we can build a strong readership) 
  • Costs associated with producing content (stock photography and video etc.)
  • Costs associated with preparing content for publishing (design, layout, etc.)

Here are some reasons to feel great about
supporting Inspire U Magazine:

  • you will help bring into existence a publication that brings Beauty and Inspiration to the world!
  • you will help create a space (digital & global) where many people, regardless of their background or how well known they are, will have a chance to show their work and further their cause!
  • you can receive a little something for your generosity, we have put together a series of perks of an artistic and inspirational nature! 

Or?

If you like our idea but choose not to support us by a direct financial contribution please consider leaving us a comment, sending this campaign to friends on your list or posting a link on your social media (campaign URL at top of this pg) or use the Indiegogo share tools! We would really appreciate this kind of support- so Thanks!

You can also follow us on Google+ or Like us on Facebook or check our website and we will let you know when we launch so you can check it out first hand!


Finally 

Thanks for taking the time to check this out and giving us the opportunity to share with you our excitement about this project. If you have decided to contribute then please accept our sincere gratitude! 

We have a track record of tackling and completing projects and our past business experience combined with our giddy enthusiasm makes it possible for you to have total confidence that this project will come to fruition and your funds will be well spent!

Once Again - Thank You!!

Kristina & Aaron Beck


More About The Perks!

We would love to give subscriptions to contributors but unfortunately this is in the hands of the App store, Google Play, the Amazon App store, and other stores that actually sell the subscriptions. Instead we have come up with some fun, creative perks with the help of some of our contributors! ( Please Note for all enthusiastic want to be contributors, you can use your credit card easily on PayPal :)  we are registered as Florence David Ventures Inc.)




Coby's "Painting With Water Photography Project"

These images look much more like oil or water color paintings, but they are actually unaltered photographs of reflected objects in urban settings. Coby will be a featured artist in the Premier Issue of Inspire U.

story:
"Bojagi Wrapping Cloths: The Art of Korean Stitching" explores traditional and contemporary Korean stitch and quilted fabric methods in this 2-hour DVD from Studio Galli Productions.  Three Bojagi projects:  Patchwork Bojagi (Jogakbo), Gift Wrap Bojagi (Yemulbo), and Covering Bojagi (Sangbo) (cover photos) are presented demonstrating the basic stitches, fabrics, and techniques needed to make your own beautiful Bojagi.

English Audio Track • Englsh Subtitles

Subtitles in Spanish • Subtítulos en Español

Dating back to the 13th Century, Bojagi (bow-jaw-gee) Korean Wrapping Cloths are generally regarded as one of the most unique and precious forms of Korean Arts & Crafts. Not only are Bojagi beautiful, but they are versatile -- everything from wedding or birthday celebration gifts to seasonal bedding is wrapped inside a Bojagi which can be used over and over again.  In fact there are at least as many uses for a Bojagi in Korean life as there are styles and designs.  Bojagi are usually square and come in a range of sizes. Fabrics used to make a Bojagi include silk, cotton, hemp and ramie. There are many different types of Bojagi including lined or unlined, patch-worked, embroidered, painted, gold-leafed, and quilted.


With a BA in Clothing and Textiles and an MA in Fashion Design, Youngmin Lee has presented numerous workshops, classes and demonstrations on Korean Textile Arts including workshops at the San Francisco Asian Art Museum and the Pacific International Quilt Festival in Santa Clara, California.


For a $50 Contribution we will include both the "Bojagi Wrapping Cloths" DVD plus a copy of our DVD, "Arimatsu-Narumi Shibori: Celebrating 400 Years of Japanese Artisan Design".   This fascinating DVD documents the work of the Shibori artisans of Arimatsu and Narumi villages in Japan today and shows the ancient techniques of hand Shibori as well as some rarely seem machine-aided Shibori. Twenty artists from the villages of Arimatsu and Narumi demonstrate the most refined Shibori techniques.

Narrated by Yoshiko Iwamoto Wada in English & Japanese. 155 Minutes.
English • Japanese Language Track
English • Japanese • Spanish Subtitles 

Your support matters to us a great deal.  Without the ongoing support of individuals, corporate sponsors, museums and galleries, Studio Galli Productions would not be able to bring such unique and high quality films to the marketplace.  

Your contribution to this campaign helps us promote Korean Arts & Crafts to a larger global community, to preserve the art form, to inspire new artists around the world, and to financially support the artists we work with.  

Studio Galli Fine Arts & Crafts Films has produced about 30 textile, craft and lutherie DVDs and about 100 video segments for craft events in London, New York, San Francisco and many other locations.  Our DVDs feature world class artists teaching on a variety of subjects appealing to a wide range audience.  A complete list of our films is available from our website:

story:
Get to know Colombia through its cultural symbols. A creative ilustrated book. 

  

                                                              


Ediciones de la casa es un sello editorial fundado por una pareja de diseñadores que se ha propuesto resaltar la cultura y las tradiciones de Colombia, pais que tiene mucho que ofrecer culturalmente y que abre las puertas al mundo con la calidez de su gente. Como su nombre lo dice nuestras publicaciones nacen en casa con profundo interés en la calidad del resultado.  

Ediciones de la casa is a plublishing house founded by a couple of designers with the goal of highlighting the colombian culture and traditions. Colombia is a country that has a lot to offer in culture and opens its doors to the world with the warmth of its people. As stated in its name our work is done in home with huge interest in the quality of the end product. 

                                                 

     
  • El título CON ALMA VIDA Y SOMBRERO  proviene de una expresión popular que describe la pasión y las ganas con las que el colombiano hace sus cosas por simples que sean.  En este libro encontrará desde platos de cocina tradicional y objetos artesanales hasta vehículos de transporte, que nos representan y nos describen. Es un libro de pequeño formato, grande en sentimiento, totalmente ilustrado con una breve descripción en inglés y en español de cada objeto.                                                                                                               
  • The name CON ALMA VIDA Y SOMBRERO comes from a popular expression that describes the desire and passion that Colombians give when doing even the simplest things. In this book you will find from traditional food dishes, to hand crafted objects or transport vehicles that represent and describe us. It’s a book of small format, big with sentiment and totally illustrated with a brief description in English and Spanish of each object.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
  • Esta publicación rinde homenaje a 68 símbolos colombianos y sobre todo al trabajo del artesano que ha mantenido por años la tradición de nuestra gente.
  • This book pays tribute to 68 Colombian symbols and most important of all the work of the artisans that have maintained, for years, the tradition of our people.
                                                                                                                                                                              
    •  

  • Gracias a su  ayuda lograremos hacer realidad la publicación de esta obra que se encuentra finalizada en un 85% en su etapa de diseño y pre impresión. Aun necesitamos 2 meses más de trabajo  y aunque hemos invertido nuestro tiempo en realizar este proyecto ahora entramos en la etapa de producción y acabados que incluyen el trabajo de muchas personas.   

  • Thanks to your help we will be able to finish this book that its 85 % done, which is in its period of design and preprinting. We still need two more months of work and even though we have put all of our time in the making of this project we will now enter the stage of production and finishing touches that include the work of a lot of people.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Con el logro de la meta de financiación podremos imprimir  nuestro libro en pasta dura con su estuche en cartón imitando una caja de madera ( o guacal como le decimos en Colombia). Queremos editar el libro de la mejor forma sin que se vuelva costoso.

Si lo logramos, "tendremos libro". Todos nuestros colaboradores serán certificados como miembros de nuestra comunidad y obtendrán un descuento del 20% sobre futuras compras, cuando salga al mercado.

Si no llegamos a la meta en el tiempo establecido, "Para atrás, ni para coger impulso", solamente ajustaremos la cantidad de ejemplares a imprimir que sea posible, pero nunca se afectará la calidad del resultado final. 


What we need and what you get

Achieving our goal will allow us to print our book in hard cover with a cardboard case imitating a wooden box or guacal like it’s called in Colombia. We want to produce and publish this book the best way possible without making it expensive.

All of those who contribute will be certificated as loyal members of our community and will get a 20% discount in future purchases, when it reaches the market.

If we don’t reach our goal in time, “we won’t go backwards”, we will only adjust the quantity of books that we can print, but the quality of the end product won’t be affected. 

   El impacto

Colombia ha sido un pais golpeado por problemas como el narcotráfico y conflictos internos... Ya no queremos más de esto! Tenemos un inmenso patrimonio cultural y sobre todo en nuestra gente sencilla y alegre, por algo dicen que, a pesar de todo, somos de los paises más felices del mundo.  Así queremos que sea nuestro libro, un homenaje  sencillo a lo auténtico de nuestra gente a través de sus símbolos.

Queremos que conozcan este libro no solo en nuestro país sino en todos los lugares donde despertemos el interés por conocernos de forma diferente. Ya hicimos una preedición de esta publicación para mirar su alcance a nivel local y su resultado nos motiva a seguir adelante actualizando la información como lo estaremos haciendo para esta edición con la ayuda de INDIEGOGO

Somos concientes de que este es un proyecto de interés local pero también sabemos que hay muchas personas y entidades en el mundo, interesadas en apoyar iniciativas como la nuestra, que aportan desde su lugar y desde su óptica para lograr un planeta mejor. 

The impact

Colombia has been a country struck by problems as the drug trafficking and internal conflicts... We do not want any more of this! We have an immense cultural heritage and especially in our simple and happy people, that is why is said that, regardless, we are one of the happiest countries of the world. We want our book to be this way, a simple honoring to the authenticity of our people across his symbols.  

We want this book to be known not only in our country but in all the places where we might wake up the interest of other people to get to know us differently. We did a preprinting of this publication to look at the reaction of the people at a local level, its result motivates us to continue updating forward the information of this edition with  the help of INDIEGOGO.                                                                                                               

We are aware that this is a project of local interest but we also know that there are many persons and entities in the world, interested in supporting projects like ours, they contribute from their home and their point of view to achieve a better planet.

Toda colaboración es valiosa

Todo aporte es importante, también es valiosa tu ayuda compartiendo esta campaña con más personas

Any collaboration are important

Any collaboration is important, we also appreciate you sharing this campaign with your friends and family.

                                                                                                                                                                      Las recompensas 

Todas nuestras recompensas incluyen un sello distintivo que lo acreditará como colaborador de nuestra campaña a través de INDIEGOGO. Conozca las opciones.

Rewards

All our rewards will include the INDIEGOGO logo that will make you an official helper of this campaign. Learn about the options.

                                                               

                                                                                                                            

    

                                                                                                        Recompensas post campaña 

Todos nuestros colaboradores obtendrán un 20% de descuento sobre el precio de venta del libro y por compras mayores a 30 unidades ofrecemos personalizar sus libros con su marca o la de su empresa  sin costo adicional (excelente alternativa como regalo)

Rewards Post Campaign

Every helper will get a 20% discount over the price of the book and if it’s a purchase over 30 units we offer to personalize their books with the brand or the company with no extra cost (excellent alternative as a gift)
story_txt:
Get to know Colombia through its cultural symbols. A creative ilustrated book. 
  
                                                              

Ediciones de la casa es un sello editorial fundado por una pareja de diseñadores que se ha propuesto resaltar la cultura y las tradiciones de Colombia, pais que tiene mucho que ofrecer culturalmente y que abre las puertas al mundo con la calidez de su gente. Como su nombre lo dice nuestras publicaciones nacen en casa con profundo interés en la calidad del resultado.  


Ediciones de la casa is a plublishing
house founded by a couple of designers with the goal of highlighting the colombian
culture and traditions. Colombia is a country that has a lot to offer in
culture and opens its doors to the world with the warmth of its people. As
stated in its name our work is done in home with huge interest in the quality
of the end product. 
                                                  El título CON ALMA VIDA Y SOMBRERO  proviene de una expresión popular que describe la pasión y las ganas con las que el colombiano hace sus cosas por simples que sean.  En este libro encontrará desde platos de cocina tradicional y objetos artesanales hasta vehículos de transporte, que nos representan y nos describen. Es un libro de pequeño formato, grande en sentimiento, totalmente ilustrado con una breve descripción en inglés y en español de cada objeto.                                                                                                               


The name CON ALMA VIDA Y SOMBRERO comes from a popular expression that describes the desire and passion that Colombians give when doing even the simplest things. In this book you will find from traditional food dishes, to hand crafted objects or transport vehicles that represent and describe us. It’s a book of small format, big with sentiment and totally illustrated with a brief description in English and Spanish of each object.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           


Esta publicación rinde homenaje a 68 símbolos colombianos y sobre todo al trabajo del artesano que ha mantenido por años la tradición de nuestra gente.


This book pays tribute to 68 Colombian symbols and most important of all the work of the artisans that have maintained, for years, the tradition of our people.                                                                                                                                                                          
 
Gracias a su  ayuda lograremos hacer realidad la publicación de esta obra que se encuentra finalizada en un 85% en su etapa de diseño y pre impresión. Aun necesitamos 2 meses más de trabajo  y aunque hemos invertido nuestro tiempo en realizar este proyecto ahora entramos en la etapa de producción y acabados que incluyen el trabajo de muchas personas.   
Thanks to your help we will be able to finish this
book that its 85 % done, which is in its period of design and preprinting. We
still need two more months of work and even though we have put all of our time
in the making of this project we will now enter the stage of production and
finishing touches that include the work of a lot of people.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Con el logro de la meta de financiación podremos imprimir  nuestro libro en pasta dura con su estuche en cartón imitando una caja de madera ( o guacal como le decimos en Colombia). Queremos editar el libro de la mejor forma sin que se vuelva costoso.
Si lo logramos, "tendremos libro". Todos nuestros colaboradores serán certificados como miembros de nuestra comunidad y obtendrán un descuento del 20% sobre futuras compras, cuando salga al mercado.
Si no llegamos a la meta en el tiempo establecido, "Para atrás, ni para coger impulso", solamente ajustaremos la cantidad de ejemplares a imprimir que sea posible, pero nunca se afectará la calidad del resultado final. 



What we need and what you get
Achieving
our goal will allow us to print our book in hard cover with a cardboard case
imitating a wooden box or guacal like
it’s called in Colombia. We want to produce and publish this book the best way
possible without making it expensive. 
All of
those who contribute will be certificated as loyal members of our community and
will get a 20% discount in future purchases, when it reaches the market. 
If we don’t
reach our goal in time, “we won’t go backwards”, we will only adjust the
quantity of books that we can print, but the quality of the end product won’t
be affected. 
   El impacto
Colombia ha sido un pais golpeado por problemas como el narcotráfico y conflictos internos... Ya no queremos más de esto! Tenemos un inmenso patrimonio cultural y sobre todo en nuestra gente sencilla y alegre, por algo dicen que, a pesar de todo, somos de los paises más felices del mundo.  Así queremos que sea nuestro libro, un homenaje  sencillo a lo auténtico de nuestra gente a través de sus símbolos.
Queremos que conozcan este libro no solo en nuestro país sino en todos los lugares donde despertemos el interés por conocernos de forma diferente. Ya hicimos una preedición de esta publicación para mirar su alcance a nivel local y su resultado nos motiva a seguir adelante actualizando la información como lo estaremos haciendo para esta edición con la ayuda de INDIEGOGO
Somos concientes de que este es un proyecto de interés local pero también sabemos que hay muchas personas y entidades en el mundo, interesadas en apoyar iniciativas como la nuestra, que aportan desde su lugar y desde su óptica para lograr un planeta mejor. 
The impact
Colombia has been a country struck by problems as the drug trafficking and internal conflicts... We do not want any more of this! We have an immense cultural heritage and especially in our simple and happy people, that is why is said that, regardless, we are one of the happiest countries of the world. We want our book to be this way, a simple honoring to the authenticity of our people across his symbols.  
We want this book to be known not only in our country but in all the
places where we might wake up the interest of other people to get to know us differently. We
did a preprinting of this publication to look at the reaction of the people at a local level, its result motivates us to continue updating forward the information of this edition
with  the help of INDIEGOGO.                                                                                                               
We are aware that this is a project of local
interest but we also know that there are many persons and entities in the
world, interested in supporting projects like ours, they contribute from their home and their point of view to achieve a better planet.
Toda colaboración es valiosa

Todo aporte es importante, también es valiosa tu ayuda compartiendo esta campaña con más personas

Any collaboration are important

Any collaboration is
important, we also appreciate you sharing this campaign with your friends and family.                                                                                                                                                                      Las recompensas 

Todas nuestras recompensas incluyen un sello distintivo que lo acreditará como colaborador de nuestra campaña a través de INDIEGOGO. Conozca las opciones.


Rewards
All our rewards will include the INDIEGOGO logo that will make you an official helper of this campaign. Learn about the options.                                                               



                                                                                                                            
    
                                                                                                        Recompensas post campaña 
Todos nuestros colaboradores obtendrán un 20% de descuento sobre el precio de venta del libro y por compras mayores a 30 unidades ofrecemos personalizar sus libros con su marca o la de su empresa  sin costo adicional (excelente alternativa como regalo)

Rewards Post Campaign
Every helper will get a 20% discount over the price of the book and if it’s a purchase over 30 units we offer to personalize their books with the brand or the company with no extra cost (excellent alternative as a gift)

story:
Short Summary

QuailBellMagazine.com is a new(ish) but popular and thriving website based in Richmond, VA. With a core (volunteer) staff of primarily VCU students and recent grads, our online 'zine features work by contributors from across the globe. We showcase pieces that inform and entertain audiences in the realms of the imaginary, the nostalgic, and the otherworldly. In October 2011, we released our first print 'zine, Quail Bell Express 1. After our friend and Managing Editor died a few weeks later, we created a special edition of Issue 1 and re-released the 'zine in Spring 2012--distributing it for free across Richmond. Now we're looking to release Issue 2...with your help, please!

Quail Bell believes in social innovation, community engagement, and bringing Richmond's creative scene to national attention. Our website has already gotten people across the world interested in RVA, with one reader in Portland, Oregon saying, "I wish I could come hang out with you guys and the fairies of Richmond! You have such a creative spirit and always seem to have fun!" We even have the support of notables like Doe Deere, Voltaire, and David Malki !
 
Besides garnering the attention of people nation-wide, Issue 2 of our print 'zine, Quail Bell Express, would also help Richmonders better appreciate history and folklore in a new context. Because it would be available across Richmond for free, anyone in RVA can pick up a copy. (People in other parts of the world can order copies directly from QuailBellMagazine.com.) As the 'zine continues to grow, Quail Bell intends to use it as the centerpiece for Richmond-based fundraisers.

What We Need & What You Get

At this point, we are asking to raise $1,000 in order to 1) print copies of the 'zine at a volume discount, and 2) distribute them across Richmond. Nobody's making a profit here and all of us are volunteers! Anything we raise will go directly to these efforts. Your perks? See our list! They're all quirky, collectible, and truly representative of art and culture works curated by a Richmond staff. We really appreciate your help!

The Impact

A free 'zine representative of, as we said before, art and culture works curated by a Richmond staff. Let's show the world what RVA can do--it's good!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please bring people to our website, QuailBellMagazine.com. Read it, share links, and just generate attention and interest in Quail Bell! Thank you so much!

story:
Illustrator Jack Hudson teams up with 3D image-making duo Lord Whitney to produce a body of work inspired by the most vibrant, iconic, and downright weird record covers in history.

Over the last few weeks we have lovingly created an entire back catalogue of LP cover designs for a series of fictitious musical artists to be featured in an exhibition at Leeds Gallery, Munro House starting with a private view on 27th April 2013.

We would love you to be a part of it by helping towards the costs of putting on the exhibition - materials, printing, framing, hire costs, refreshments etc.  You're contribution will not only help make this happen, we also have some amazing perks for you! If we're fortunate enough to go over our goal, any extra will go towards making the private view extra special, may allow us to take the exhibition to London and also go towards us creating more exciting work for you - so far this is a self-initiated project where none of the artists are getting paid to do the work. We feel strongly about producing high quality artwork to encourage and excite the Leeds/Northern art scene and the more you can support it, the more we can produce for you!


This feast for the senses will be equally delicious to eyes and ears, with established musical artists from bands such as Pulled Apart by Horses, Dept. M, Lone Wolf, These Monsters and Sky Larkin penning original songs inspired by these outré artworks. It will launch you into a sonic time warp where only the best bits from an era rich in music and visuals are permitted. Doves will cry. Hair will spontaneously perm.

Expect the private view to bring a touch of Club Tropicana to Leeds, complete with colour, music, and exotic fruit-based beverages. Just remember to remove your rose tinted aviators, and you may be able to spot some of the ‘real’ superstars themselves…

Private View: Saturday 27th April from 6pm
Exhibition Dates : 28th April - 7th May
Gallery Opening Hours : Monday - Saturday 10am - 6pm
www.leedsgallery.com

NB Original full size Artworks will also be available to buy exclusively at the exhibition

All your help is appreciated, if you can't contribute, the power of spreading the word and coming along to the exhibition is not to be underestimated.

Thanks you!
